channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An international deal for James Constantinou on a wine collection in Lanzarote may be worth a million Euros, and a couple look to sell their one-of-a-kind house boat. Elsewhere, a gastro pub owner wants to take a loan out against a £250,000 Bentley, and James considers a risky deal on an unusual giant gemstone. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James heads to Ibiza to appraise a luxury speedboat worth over £100,000 and a diamond ring, while Lawrence values a piece of boxing memorabilia. Designer handbag expert Claudia must brush up on her history when she is confronted with a rare purse.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp revisits Aberdeenshire couple Karen and Russell, discovering they are not living in the property she found for them, but instead inhabiting a place they could never have imagined possible. In Buckinghamshire, Phil Spencer finds out how house-hunters Andrew and Emma, who had £625,000 to spend, are getting on in their new home.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jim Rogers, chairman and CEO of Kampgrounds of America, goes undercover within his own company to discover whether his employees share his boy-scout philosophy. However, Jim's wife Sandy fears his naturally outgoing and cheerful nature could undo his cover story as a recently unemployed reality show contestant.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Oceana, a restaurant in the heart of New Orleans, to try to change the fortunes of a business run by two quarrelling brothers. The chef soon discovers that the ingredients are of poor quality and could pose a health hazard, but he struggles to make his point with the owners without causing an even bigger conflict between them.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the White House in Brighton for the third day of the competition, where hosts Sean Edlin and Kathryn Turnbull run a laid-back seaside B&B. Denise and Jackie think the rooms are not well equipped and Marianne finds them clinical, while Mike and Neal are unsure about the price. Tensions are temporarily alleviated by a visit to the famous Theatre Royal, but Marianne and Deina continue to cause trouble at dinner. In the morning, a locally sourced breakfast impresses some of the guests, but the group must decide whether they are getting value for money.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business manager Alison Bennett hosts the first dinner party in Glasgow, where she hopes that her Thai menu of chicken satay, red-roasted pork and chili chocolate combs will help to secure her the £1,000 prize. However, it remains to be seen whether any of her guests are able to use the chopsticks she has provided.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Butcher Graeme Curley hosts the second night in Glasgow, where he has planned a meaty menu complete with pork ribs. He hopes to wow his guests by serving steak - and by bringing some of his trade to the dinner table.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Michelle Blackett is the host on day three in Glasgow, and hopes to impress the diners by preparing a menu of exceedingly well-appointed food. Over the course of the evening, Michelle's guests discover her hidden heritage, and hospitality student Erwin - who speaks five languages - does his best to add the `Glaswegian' dialect to his arsenal.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ballet enthusiast and hospitality management student Erwin Orduz hosts the fourth dinner party in Glasgow and hopes to impress his guests with an evening of shocks and surprises. He attempts hotel-style presentation and serves up his meals in a dining room that has been decorated with a menagerie theme of animals and nakedness.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Yvonne Finlayson hosts the final night of the cooking competition in Glasgow, offering her guests a combination of `scientifically-infused' food, high-octane entertainment and scintillating chat - plus a healthy dose of revelations - to try to claim the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer assist two couples in their search for homes in Hertfordshire. Newly engaged accountants Liz and Neil are hoping to raise a family near the town of Tring, while in St Albans, married couple David and Claire want to find a place where they can finally settle down, after moving house five times in five years.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Wiltshire residents Peter and Karen Greaves find a property for £50,000 or less on Spain's Costa Blanca.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: Comedian Dom Joly reveals what happens to micro pigs when they grow up, while Steve Jones, Kate Quilton and Noel Fitzpatrick return as they continue to try to find permanent homes for animals at the Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter. They also attempt to rehouse a whole host of pets from other rescue centres around the UK.(n)

programme.title: Old People's Home for 4 Year Olds
programme.desc: Part one of two. For six weeks, 10 four year olds will share their classroom with 11 pensioners. In an experiment led by three geriatric specialists, the young and older group follow the same timetable in a new nursery set within a retirement village near Bristol. The senior group will undergo tests to measure mood, memory and mobility during their daily interaction with the kids.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, two landlords rush to the scene of a police raid, where the occupant has turned their property into a large cannabis factory. Meanwhile, when the local council holds up their housing benefit claims in Doncaster, an agent decides to evict all of his 160 benefit tenants.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook.(n)

programme.title: Diana: In Her Own Words
programme.desc: Documentary featuring never-before-seen footage of Diana, Princess of Wales, recorded by her speech consultant between 1992 and 1993 as she sought to define her public persona and present her own version of events reported in the press, touching on her marriage and experience of public life. The programme also features in-depth interviews with people close to her.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The dads are under the spotlight at Liverpool Women's Hospital as three very different men prepare for fatherhood. Midwife Kirsty looks after Rebecca and Jack, a soldier who's more confident about going into battle than he is about changing nappies. Mum Billie arrives with her ex-partner Nathan, and although they're apart, they hope they can raise their child together. Cameras also follow John, who has always wanted to be a dad. He hopes some of his broodiness will rub off on girlfriend Natalie.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Headteacher Emma arrives in resus having been in a collision with a bus while cycling home from the school she works at. As she is treated, her husband Mick reflects on being informed what had happened. Meanwhile, 33-year-old Josh is treated for severe back pain, and 87-year-old Pamela is examined for a possible blood clot in her leg, and tells the doctors about her childhood in London during the Blitz.(n)

programme.title: Get a House for Free
programme.desc: Landlord Marco Robinson - who owns a business and property empire worth £25million - is looking to give away a three-bedroom flat in Preston, worth around £120,000. Cameras follow him as he seeks the right person or people who he thinks will benefit most from the property.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr is joined by First Dates love ambassador Fred Sirieix, food critic Jay Rayner, deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander to put fish pie, lager and smoked bacon to the test. Plus, the quick-fire public taste test this time is for garlic bread.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: The jurors are three days in, and the game is getting serious. But Dan's competitive spirit may cause divisions in the ranks.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James Constantinou faces rare items that are allegedly from Arctic explorer Ernest Shackleton's expeditions and values some vintage Chanel handbags. He also discovers a problem when he takes assistant Jo out for a terrifying test drive in a client's Porsche.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James tries to make an £85,000 deal on a modified sports car, while designer handbag expert Claudia heads to Germany to value a large collection of bags owned by a former New York socialite. A female bodybuilder wants to sell jewellery so she can fund her new hobby, and a golf fanatic brings in a case of vintage wine.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit two sets of house-hunters. In North Yorkshire, they catch up with Trudi and Steve who relocated from Edinburgh to be nearer their relatives, and in Luton, Bedfordshire, the experts find out whether community artist Zena has been able to move out of her parents' home and get onto the property ladder.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: John Wilson, the President and Chief Operating Officer of Rollins Incorporated - the parent company of eight pest-control firms including flagship brand Orkin - goes undercover. He poses as a contestant on a reality TV competition who is trying to win money for his own business, and works alongside his employees to make sure the organisation is heading for another century of keeping homes rodent-free.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zeke's, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. The new proprietors, husband and wife duo Darryl and Ellen Cortello, focused all the efforts on the financial side of things, so it is up to Gordon to show them that they first need to love food to make any profit.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wakes Hall Lodges near Colchester is the fourth and final visit of the week, where Neal and Mike are wowed by the five-star self-catering accommodation, complete with hot tubs and lakeside views. The others aren't so sure about the `luxury' breakfast hamper, however, especially as it means cooking their own. An afternoon of dog agility gives manager Marianne Cammack the chance to demonstrate her authority, although over dinner, her domineering conversation causes Jackie to finally snap.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Wrestling promoter Dale Harvey hosts the first dinner party in Derby, where he hopes to impress aspiring thespian Beth Dunmore, business support manager Jo-Anna, mother-of-three Ondine Shardlow, and triathlete David Morris with a wrestling-themed extravaganza featuring large men in tight lycra. However, a fractious royal debate dampens the mood.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business support manager Jo-Anna hosts the second dinner party in Derby, and hopes to wow her guests with a glitz and glam evening - complete with ball gowns and poetry. However, David is hoping for a more lively night - and his antics do not impress fellow contestant Dale.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: PR whizz Beth Dunmore hosts the third night in Derby, and she hopes to impress her guests with her vaguely Middle Eastern menu. However, she has her work cut out when it comes to the fussy David Morris, whose confidence seems to be growing as the week progresses. Beth has a fan in cruise ship connoisseur Jo-Anna, though, while single mum Ondine Shardlow is disappointed with the level of competition and thinks she has the week in the bag.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ondine Shardlow hosts the fourth dinner party in Derby, hoping to impress her guests with a flavoursome Greek holiday-inspired menu. However, her carefully planned evening takes a turn for the worse when she manages to insult Dale, and Jo-Anna displays some questionable table manners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final day of the dinner party contest in Derby and the turn of triathlete David Morris to serve his offerings. Ondine is not impressed by his small portions, big flavours approach, and is even less satisfied with Jo-Anna's behaviour during the week. The host throws an impromptu work-out class where wrestling promoter Dale Harvey is put through his paces, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer's latest mission takes them to Sussex, where they help to solve two different house-hunting problems. Ashlee Newton has been saving for nine years to buy her first home, and is looking for a period flat near the bars and restaurants of Brighton or Hove. Colin Amery and Robin Balance are getting ready to move in together for the first time, and want to find a property they can renovate from scratch - which means they are paying particular attention to architectural details.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: After 30 years of marriage and a life dedicated to their family, Simon and Mary Loyne feel the time has arrived to focus on themselves. They have sold their Cheshire home and cannot wait to move to Spain's Costa Almeria. Danni Menzies shows them five fabulous properties for their budget of £100,000, but do they go for a townhouse with a man cave Simon really wants or an apartment close to the beach, in Mary's perfect location?.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and Steve Jones host an appeal to rehome all the animals in Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter, attempting to encourage would-be owners to consider them first over buying a pet. Many more rescue centres across the country are also taking part, while Kate Quilton follows adoptions as they happen in real time.(n)

programme.title: Old People's Home for 4 Year Olds
programme.desc: Ten four year olds are half way through an ambitious six-week experiment, as they share their classroom with 11 pensioners who all follow the same timetable in a nursery near Bristol. Has the energy and activities of the younger group had a measurable impact on the pensioners? Can this ambitious experiment transform the way Britain cares for its increasingly older population?.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and David O'Doherty compete against Jon Richardson and Natasia Demetriou. John Kearns joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Over the last decade, incidents of violence perpetrated by young men have risen by 22% and this edition examines the stories behind some of these calls and crimes. In Swindon, officers Emily Grigor and Simon Sanghera are called to arrest a man in his early twenties who has ripped off his top in a drunken rage before putting his fist through a wall and his foot through a window in a bar.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: That '70s Show

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.sub-title: Boys Are Cuties, Girls Have Cooties.
programme.desc: After Melissa's fall from grace, Jill tries hard to be Abby's new favourite but quickly learns that it is no easy task. Abby's mood is at an all-time low over the news that rival teacher Cathy has returned to the competition circuit after weeks of hiding.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.desc: Things go wrong as the friends prepare for a party. Halloween edition of the US comedy series, featuring parodies of horror and suspense classics including Alfred Hitchcock's Vertigo.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: A former employee tries to sue Red for wrongful dismissal, while Jackie and Fez enter a roller-disco contest. Nostalgic comedy series, starring Laura Prepon, Topher Grace and Kurtwood Smith.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Janet returns home, but appears to have piled on the pounds in her absence - much to the dismay of Michael, who is not renowned for his tact and does not know how to tell her she is looking decidedly overweight. Starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire is invited to an unsupervised party at Erica's house, but Michael refuses to let her go - much to the dismay of Janet, who thinks he should be more trusting. Starring Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Kerry is furious to learn that Paul is relaxing the household curfew for Bridget just because she is dating the best sportsman in the state - high-school basketball star Travis `the Rainman' Smith. John Ritter and Katey Sagal star.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.title: Neighbours

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: The pressure is on for the Candy Apples, and no one's spot is guaranteed. Dance dad Rick worries when Jalen is assigned his first contemporary solo, and Cathy battles with Anthony as she struggles to regain control of her studio.(n)

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Families from opposite ends of the wealth and class divide swap homes, budgets and social status for seven days to discover how the other half lives. The Bentleys from Lincolnshire trade places with the Carter-Begbie family from Stamford. The Bentleys rank in the top 10 per cent of Britain's wealthy, and live in a large four-bedroom house with three bathrooms, two reception rooms, a top-of-the-range kitchen, conservatory and games room. The Carter-Begbies live in a rented three-bedroom house and have a weekly budget of £140. This week, however, that will rise to almost £1,800.(n)

programme.title: Mr Deeds
programme.desc: A naive pizza parlour owner inherits $40billion and moves to New York, where he encounters unscrupulous opportunists keen to get their hands on the money - and a ruthless reporter determined to tell his story. Remake of 1936 romantic comedy Mr Deeds Goes to Town, with Adam Sandler, Winona Ryder, John Turturro, Allen Covert, Peter Gallagher and Jared Harris.(n)

programme.desc: Johnny Depp stars in this intense psychological spin on the horrific legend of Jack the Ripper(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Director Peter Weir's first turn behind the camera since 1998's critically acclaimed The Truman Show, Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World is based on two Napoleonic War-era adventure novels in author Patrick O'Brian's Aubrey/Maturin series, Master and Commander and The Far Side of the World. Russell Crowe stars as Captain Jack Aubrey, a high-seas adventurer who maintains a strong bond with ship-surgeon Stephen Maturin (Paul Bettany). After conquering much of Europe already, Napoleon's forces have set their sights on taking Britain, so Aubrey and the crew of his ship, the HMS Surprise, take to the Pacific to intercept any attacking ships from the French fleet. When Aubrey eyes a renegade French super-frigate, the Surprise pursues, leading to an adrenaline-charged chase through the distant reaches of the sea. Edward Woodall, James D'Arcy, and Lee Ingleby also star as members of the Surprise's crew(n)

programme.title: The Young Messiah
programme.desc: As his family travel from Egypt to Nazareth, a 7-year-old Jesus wishes to learn more about his identity and place in the world in this stirring biblical drama. Meanwhile, Herod Antipas dispatches a Roman centurion to kill the boy, whose miraculous powers might be a threat to his reign(n)

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: In Alexander Payne's bittersweet comedy, two buddies, Miles and Jack, embark on Jack's stag week, a tasting trip around California's wine country, with oenophile Miles leading the way. Miles may be a wine expert but he's also a bitter divorcee, depressed and in love with a waitress, Maya, whose presence always leaves him tongue-tied. Jack is a faded actor who can't quite resign himself to marriage when there are still obtainable women in the world, married or not, and when he meets Stephanie at a tasting, he swears Miles to secrecy about the wedding. And so the foursome continue their trip... Alexander Payne's Oscar and BAFTA-winning road trip is a classic of friendship and crisis, with four outstanding leads(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Hilary Swank adds another outstanding characterization to her Oscar-winning résumé. She plays Holly Kennedy, a young widow whose late husband (Gerard Butler) arranged to have 10 letters delivered posthumously to encourage her to carry on with her life. Directed by Richard LaGravenese, who cowrote the moving script with Steven Rogers. The film is an adaptation of Cecelia Ahern's popular first novel, which she wrote when she was 21(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two longtime friends take stock of their accomplished artistic careers in this meditative drama written and directed by Paolo Sorrentino. Michael Caine stars as Fred Ballinger, a retired composer who, at the behest of his daughter (Rachel Weisz), is on vacation in the Alps with his friend Mick Boyle (Harvey Keitel), a filmmaker currently working on a new project. Fred believes he is enjoying his retirement, but he is soon approached with an offer of a British knighthood if he'll conduct a performance of a famous piece he wrote(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Arnie's at his best as tough L.A. detective John Kimble who must find a drug lord's wife so she can testify in court. Problem is, she's gone into hiding to protect her son. With only the name of the kid's elementary school, Kimble must go undercover... As a kindergarten teacher! Academy Award winner Linda Hunt joins the cast with Academy Award nominee Cathy Moriarty in this great blend of action, thrills, and humor(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: As the end of the first Gulf War nears, a group of adventurous American soldiers attempt to find a huge cache of hidden Iraqi gold(n)

programme.title: The Color of Money
programme.desc: Paul Newman racked up an Oscar reprising his role from "The Hustler", a pool shark who takes a hotshot under his wing(n)

programme.title: Nine to Five
programme.desc: Colin Higgins' feminist comedy stars Jane Fonda, Dolly Parton and Lily Tomlin as three office workers stuck with an odious sexist pig for a boss. After her husband runs off with another woman, Judy Bernly must find work for the first time. Joining Consolidated Companies as a secretary, she is taken under the wing of super-efficient, long-time office manager Violet Newstead and fellow secretary Doralee Rhodes. The trio have the misfortune of working for Franklin Hart Jr - a first-class chauvinist, who will quite happily tip pencils on the floor just so he can ogle Rhodes' cleavage while she picks them up. When Newstead is unfairly passed over for promotion for the umpteenth time, the women head for Doralee's house to commiserate and smoke pot, which prompts revenge fantasies from each of them. But then fantasy blends with reality, and events spin out of control..(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: The hilarious hit comedy in which Marisa Tomei won an Oscar for her dazzling performance as Lisa, the girlfriend of Joe Pesci's loser lawyer Vinny. Unfortunately his first case just happens to involve his young cousin Ralph Macchio, who has been wrongly accused of the murder of a shop assistant. Down in Alabama for the trial, it's up to Vinny to save the day with a dynamite performance (provided that he can stay awake in court for long enough) - and hang on to Lisa as their relationship hits the rocks(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: After walking in on his girlfriend cheating, lawyer Mitch sets up home near the local college. It's just the chance his thirtysomething pals have been waiting for: they turn his new house into a 24-hour party house(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: In this charming sequel to the 2002 sleeper hit, Toula's family throws an even bigger Greek wedding for her parents, who learn they never officially tied the knot. Meanwhile, she deals with a daughter who's eager to escape from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A 70-year-old widower comes out of retirement to take an internship at a trendy start-up fashion company, and unexpectedly becomes a confidant for the overwhelmed young CEO(n)

programme.title: Sweet November
programme.desc: Romantic melodrama about a young woman who begins a new relationship with a different man each month in order to help them develop into more compassionate individuals. However, there are unexpected repercussions for both parties when she attempts to bring meaning to the life of a hard-hearted, career-centred business executive(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: In this touching drama, Danish painter Einar Wegener begins living as a woman named Lili, and undergoes one of the first gender-reassignment surgeries in the 1930s. Lili struggles with her new identity as it strains her marriage to artist Gerda Wegener(n)

programme.title: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
programme.desc: On his return from the Crusades, the rebel learns that his father has been murdered by the tyrannical Sheriff of Nottingham and embarks on a campaign of guerrilla warfare to protect the King's throne. The outlaw counts upon the support of his band of followers, including his Moorish companion, a drunken priest and the beautiful Maid Marian(n)

programme.title: A Serious Man
programme.desc: Meek physics professor Larry Gopnic finds his life unravelling as he deals with his cheating wife, his layabout brother, his disobedient children, threats to his tenure and a next-door neighbour who likes to sunbathe in the nude(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: Two-time Academy Award winner Tom Hanks delivers an outstanding performance in this excellent Oscar winning Drama. Chuck Noland is a Fed-Ex manager who demands that everything must be on time and travels the world to make sure punctuality is on top of everything else. He has a girlfriend, Kelly, with whom he is deeply in love with and family he hardly sees. When work intrudes on Christmas Eve, Chuck has a quick gift exchange in the car and kisses Kelly goodbye. He boards a delivery plane going overseas which gets caught in a horrendous storm and crashes into the Pacific. The sole survivor Chuck washes up on a remote island along with several Fed-Ex packages that he must use for supplies. With limited luxury, he adapts to the island over the course of 1,500 nights(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
programme.desc: Following his surprise-hit American remake of The Ring in 2002, director Gore Verbinski took on Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl, the second of recent films to be based upon Disney theme-park rides (the first being The Country Bears). When Elizabeth Swann (Keira Knightley), the daughter of Governor Swann (Jonathan Pryce) is kidnapped by a group of pirates led by Captain Barbossa (Geoffrey Rush) and taken aboard their ship, The Black Pearl, Will Turner (Orlando Bloom), the young man who loves Elizabeth despite the fact that she is promised to another, sets out to rescue her. But he can't do it alone, so he enlists the help of swashbuckling ship captain Jack Sparrow (Johnny Depp). Together the two chase after The Black Pearl, but they soon discover that the captain and crew aren't your average pirates. Cursed to remain between the living and the dead, Barbossa and his men look like skeletons when basked in the moonlight. When it is revealed that the only thing that can break the curse is Elizabeth's blood, Jack and Will are faced with a race against time and a battle against the undead to save the Governor's daughter(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. programme.title: Mirror Mirror
programme.desc: Julia Roberts, Armie Hammer and Lily Collins star in Tarsem Singh's reworking of the Snow White fairy tale. When her father the King goes missing on a quest to save his kingdom, the 18-year-old Snow White is left alone with her stepmother the Queen, who has raised the girl since her natural mother died giving birth to her. This devotion should not be mistaken for love, for the Queen is utterly self-absorbed and evil. And when both women are equally attracted to the visiting Prince Alcott, the monarch decides to kill her rival. But Brighton, the henchman told to dispatch the princess, can't bring himself to fulfil his task and lets her go. And thus, deep in the forest, Snow White discovers a band of brigand dwarves who are only too happy to help her win the hand of her prince and depose her murderous stepmother. There are some violent scenes (hence the PG rating), but the general tone is humorous, and the acting at times plays second fiddle to the astonishing set and costume design (Eiko Ishioka was posthumously Oscar-nominated for the Best Achievement in Costume Design)(n)

programme.desc: Martin Scorsese directs this hard-hitting, highly-acclaimed contemporary gangster drama, based on the memoirs of a real-life Mafia 'wise guy'. Set on the streets of New York, the film follows the rise through the ranks of organised crime of Henry Hill, a small-time hustler who enters the sprawling crime organisation as a runner for neighbourhood don Paul Sorvino. Moving through the mob milieu, Hill comes into contact with veteran Irish hood Robert De Niro, who takes the youngster under his wing to teach him the unwritten rules of the underworld and impress upon him the value of loyalty to the members of his surrogate 'family'(n)

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars in this affectionate remake of the British classic as Charlie Croker, who, after taking over from John Bridger as the leader of a gang of thieves, celebrates his new status with a multi-million-dollar job in Venice. But gang member Steve Frezelli double-crosses his friends, kills Bridger and leaves the rest for dead. The gang survive and Croker spends a year tracking the traitor, using the safecracking skills of Bridger's daughter Stella to rob Steve and avenge her father's death. F Gary Gray's all-action movie does, of course, include the famous Minis sequence, with several of the cast doing their own driving(n)

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: Mummy's Dummies. This time we're in ancient Egypt, where the Three Stooges own a used-chariot dealership ("I'm Honest Moe, he's Honest Shemp, and that's...that's Larry"). When they bamboozle the Captain of the Royal Guard (Ralph Dunn) out of 400 shekels for a defective chariot, the Stooges are arrested and brought before the mighty King Rootentooten (Vernon Dent). Sentenced to be thrown to the crocodiles, the boys save themselves by curing the King's toothache, whereupon they are appointed Royal Chamberlains--and in this capacity, our heroes expose a crooked tax collector (Philip Van Zandt). Highlights include Shemp's disguise as the mummy of the late, great King Put-n-take-it(n)

programme.title: Sudden Death
programme.desc: Jean Claude Van Damme headlines this taut and exciting actioner. Van Damme is Darren McCord, who as the story begins is seen trapped in a blazing building, trying to save a child. The experience is traumatic and two years later, he has become fire marshal of the Pittsburgh Civic Arena. One night he and his two kids are attending a play-off hockey game between the Penguins and the Blackhawks. Also attending the game is the vice president of the US. He has no idea that he is the target of an assassination conspiracy that is to occur that very night. The leader of the killers is Joshua Foss. The villains stage a raid and begin holding the entire coliseum hostage. The crooks will only free the hostages if they receive $1.7 billion from the government in three increments at the end of each period. If their demands aren't met, the bad-guys will detonate the 10 bombs they have stashed beneath the arena. Now it is up to McCord to find those bombs and stops them(n)

programme.title: Street Fighter
programme.desc: Live-action rendition of the futuristic video game about a soldier trying to liberate hostages held by a dictator(n)

programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars in this affectionate remake of the British classic as Charlie Croker, who, after taking over from John Bridger as the leader of a gang of thieves, celebrates his new status with a multi-million-dollar job in Venice. programme.title: Goodfellas
programme.desc: Martin Scorsese directs this hard-hitting, highly-acclaimed contemporary gangster drama, based on the memoirs of a real-life Mafia 'wise guy'. Set on the streets of New York, the film follows the rise through the ranks of organised crime of Henry Hill, a small-time hustler who enters the sprawling crime organisation as a runner for neighbourhood don Paul Sorvino. programme.title: The Shawshank Redemption
programme.desc: Drama about the relationship struck up between two inmates of Shawshank State Prison over two decades. When a New England banker begins a double life sentence in 1946 for the murder of his wife and her lover, he encounters the prison 'fixer' and they become friends. The banker gains respect by giving financial advice to the guards and campaigning for better facilities - but what he really wants is his freedom(n)

programme.title: The Fugitive
programme.desc: Blockbuster adventure movie based on the TV series about a doctor who goes on the run after being wrongly convicted of murdering his wife. Dr Richard Kimble fails to persuade the court of his innocence, but a freak train crash on the way to prison enables him to escape. Pursued by a determined lawman, he must not only evade capture, but also try to clear his name by finding his wife's real killer(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A mysterious artificial being evolves faster than anticipated, and a corporate consultant is enlisted to determine the test subject's fate(n)

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: World Wrestling Entertainment superstar Kane gives a killer performance as a deranged, hulking psychopath who terrorizes eight teens working to rehab a decrepit hotel. It's no-holds-barred mayhem as the murderer employs a variety of different weapons and instruments to dispatch his victims. Directed by Gregory Dark. WWE head Vince McMahon serves as executive producer. Steven Vidler, Christina Vidal, Michael J. Pagan, Samantha Noble, Cecily Polson, Luke Pegler, Penny McNamee, Craig Horner(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: Hoosiers tells the true story of a group of underdogs who become champions. Set in the 1950s, Hoosiers is about a hard-luck, unemployed college basketball coach (Gene Hackman) who gets a chance to coach a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team. Facing resentment from the community and the team itself, Hackman manages to inspire his young athletes, leading them to the state championship with the help of the assistant coach (Dennis Hopper), who happens to be a recovering alcoholic(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Takeoff on the Godfather with the son of a mafia king taking over for his dying father(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: A cop with little regard for the rules tries to track down a sniper who is murdering the innocent in San Francisco. It is up to Dirty Harry and his partner Chico to track him down(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Sci-fi horror about a half-human, half-alien female mutant who escapes from a government laboratory and attempts to prolong the life of her species by mating with a human. Pursued by scientists and police, she passes through a chrysalid stage and takes on the appearance of a beautiful young woman. But she can also metamorphose from her eye-catching form into a repulsive, death-dealing monster(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: Sequel to the sci-fi blockbuster. After becoming the first person on Mars, astronaut Patrick Ross is infected with spores of alien DNA, resulting in a dangerously inflamed libido and an outbreak of alien offspring. Elsewhere, the monster who wreaked havoc in the original film has been cloned and united with government assassins in order to track down Ross and eliminate the new species(n)

programme.title: Blow
programme.desc: Following the life of cocaine-trafficking pioneer George Jung in a way that recalls Martin Scorsese's Casino, Blow recounts the man's days from his 1950s childhood in Boston to his downfall in the 1980s. George (played by Johnny Depp) begins his life as the son of Fred (Ray Liotta), an earnest breadwinner, and Ermine (Rachel Griffiths), who frequently walks out on them in pursuit of a more fulfilling life. When George moves west to California in the late '60s, accompanied by best pal Tuna (Ethan Suplee), he becomes an entrepreneur in the marijuana business, which soon spreads to the East Coast as well, with girlfriend Barbara (Franka Potente) smuggling the product during her stewardess shifts. George is arrested in 1972 -- at which time Barbara dies of cancer -- but George finds a new ally in Diego (Jordi Molla), who proposes the idea that he become the American conduit for Colombian kingpin Pablo Escobar (Cliff Curtis). George flourishes in the heyday of the disco era, and falls for Mirtha (Penelope Cruz), a self-serving bombshell who eventually has a daughter with him. Trouble escalates as the FBI threatens to bring George and his crew down, while he desperately tries to be a stable parent to his young offspring. Blow also features Paul Reubens and Max Perlich in featured roles(n)

programme.title: Redemption
programme.desc: An Afghanistan War veteran living in London seeks revenge against his pregnant girlfriend's killer by assuming an upper-class identity and using his connections in the Chinese mob(n)

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Daring adventurer Rick returns to Egypt for a second crack at evil high priest Imhotep. But this time, the devious shaman has enlisted the diabolical services of the Scorpion King and his army of a thousand jackal warriors(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: The Mariner (Kevin Costner) tries to rescue Enola (Tina Majorino) after she's captured by Deacon (Dennis Hopper)(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: In northern Australia at the beginning of World War II, an English aristocrat inherits a cattle station the size of Maryland. When English cattle barons plot to take her land, she reluctantly joins forces with a rough-hewn stock-man to drive 2,000 head of cattle across hundreds of miles of the country's most unforgiving land, only to still face the bombing of Darwin, Australia, by the Japanese forces that had attacked Pearl Harbor only months earlier(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This riveting crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: The Abandoned
programme.desc: In this spooky and surreal chiller, an American movie producer (Anastasia Hille) searching for her birth parents inherits a house in Russia that holds dark and dangerous secrets from her past. Directed by Nacho Cerda(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy (David Mazouz) stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force. This tale of terror was directed by Wolf Creek's Greg McLean. Kevin Bacon, Radha Mitchell, and Lucy Fry star in a Blumhouse Productions film(n)

programme.title: Heartbreak Ridge
programme.desc: A misanthropic Marine gunnery sergeant trains new recruits to invade Grenada. Meanwhile, the tough-talking veteran repeatedly runs afoul of his younger, progressive-minded superiors(n)

programme.title: The Ninth Gate
programme.desc: Eerie saga about a rare-book buyer who becomes a target of unknown forces when he's asked to find a volume about the Devil(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A thief enlists the help of mythical Egyptian gods to overthrow a vicious ruler(n)

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: High-octane action thriller about a cop who goes undercover in Los Angeles's street-racing world in order to snare a villainous gang-leader(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law) in this sidesplitting action comedy. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: Endlessly imitated, The Terminator made the reputation of cowriter/director James Cameron -- who would go on to make 1997's titanic Titanic -- and solidified the stardom of Arnold Schwarzenegger. The movie begins in a post-apocalyptic 2029, when Los Angeles has been largely reduced to rubble and is under the thumb of all-powerful ruling machines. Kyle Reese (Michael Biehn), a member of the human resistance movement, is teleported back to 1984. His purpose: to rescue Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton), the mother of the man who will lead the 21st-century rebels against the tyrannical machines, from being assassinated before she can give birth. Likewise thrust back to 1984 is The Terminator (Schwarzenegger), a grim, well-armed, virtually indestructable cyborg who has been programmed to eliminate Sarah Connor. After killing two "Sarah Connors" who turn out to be the wrong women, he finally aims his gunsights at the genuine article. This is the film in which Schwarzenegger declared "I'll be baaaack" -- and back he was, in "kinder and gentler" form, in the even more successful Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991)(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: Former LA cop Brian now makes his living driving in illegal street races in Miami. Squeezed by the FBI, he agrees to set up druglord Verone for a king-sized bust(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a group of extreme athletes who are using their specialized skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. Remake of the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: Gavin Hood's thriller stars Reese Witherspoon as Isabella Fields El-Ibrahimi, the wife of American-Egyptian chemical engineer Anwar El-Ibrahimi. When Anwar disappears on his way home from a conference in South Africa, she is driven frantic trying to find proof of his whereabouts in the face of official denial. Anwar is being held as a suspected terrorist in secrecy in Marrakech, where CIA operative Douglas Freeman is reluctantly involved in his torture. Meanwhile, one of the torturer's daughters, Fatima, is secretly in love with a fellow student who may be following extreme paths. As Hood brings the strands together, the various characters' actions intertwine, moving towards a dramatic conclusion(n)

programme.title: From Hell

programme.desc: The Battle for Caen. Allied forces move toward the city of Caen, but are halted by Panzer forces(n)

programme.title: D-Day to Victory

programme.sub-title: Battle for the Scheldt and Arnhem

programme.desc: Bonnie and Clyde. A 1930s crime spree by Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow that spanned 11 states and included armed robbery, car theft, abduction and murder, is examined(n)

This time, he reports on fake hoverboards that have caught fire in people's homes, and sophisticated copies of high-street jewellery, which are marketed as being silver, but actually contain no silver at all.(n)

programme.title: Super Small Animals
programme.desc: Patrick Aryee investigates the world of miniature creatures, from a primate no bigger than a mouse to a chameleon that can fit on a human fingertip, finding out what makes them some of the most successful animals on the planet. He reveals how the smallest armadillo manages to control its temperature in the searing desert sun, and meets a scientist who studies how really tiny spiders have a surprising trick that enables them to travel an incredible 40 miles a day using almost no energy.(n)

programme.title: My Family, Partition and Me: India 1947
programme.desc: Part one of two. Anita Rani examines the stories of four British families, one Muslim, one Hindu, one Colonial and her own Sikh one, who lived in India at the time of Partition in 1947, when the country was divided and created the new nation of Pakistan. They travel for the first time to the homes in Pakistan, India and Bangladesh that their relatives fled in terror, meeting long-lost family friends, and neighbours of other religions who shielded their families at huge personal risk.(n)

programme.title: My Big Gay Jewish Conversion
programme.desc: Simon Atkins goes on a personal journey as a gay man to discover if he could convert to Judaism, and whether it is worth sacrificing his Catholic upbringing. He starts with a trip to the local Rabbi, before heading to Judaism's homeland, Israel, and explores the streets of Tel Aviv. Simon then heads to Jerusalem, where extreme views towards homosexuality are rife.(n)

programme.title: I'm Coming Out
programme.desc: Tired of feeling like he lives a double life and having to hide his bisexuality, 19-year-old Owen decides to come out to his parents on camera. He finally builds up the confidence to tell his mother, who in a life affirming moment tells him he no longer has to hide his true sexuality from her. But he still has to tell his father, which is a prospect he is far more nervous about.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further coverage of the seventh night at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. With Usain Bolt opting not to defend his 200m title, a new champion will be crowned this evening, with Yohan Blake and Wayde van Niekerk among the favourites going into the championships. The 400m hurdles final also takes place, with a strong American contingent led by Dalilah Muhammad expected to challenge. Plus, medals are decided in the men's triple jump, and places in the women's 200m final are confirmed. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley.(n)

programme.title: Stacey Dooley Investigates
programme.sub-title: Stacey Dooley Investigates: Kids Selling Drugs Online.
programme.desc: The presenter goes undercover in the growing criminal world of Britain's digital drug dealers. Using fake profiles on various popular apps, she reveals how easy it is for children and young teenagers to get their hands on Class A drugs via social media platforms. She then gains access to one of the gangs, to find out about their trade, before asking what can be done to curb this worrying problem.(n)

programme.title: Queer Britain

programme.title: My Friend Jane
programme.desc: Documentary shedding light on the lives of Jane Austen super-fans, who read, live and breathe all-things Regency. While Austen's works are often considered genteel romances, they are often shot through with acid-sharp wit, social commentary, and a hint of biography, with certain elements from her famous novels more than mirroring aspects of Jane's own life. Here, the self-professed `Janeites' share their thoughts on why they have fallen in love with Austen's genteel narratives, and explain what the work of a vicar's daughter from Hampshire who died 200 years ago means to them.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu

There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner head to Oxfordshire to visit the UK's oldest botanic garden, before chef Mike North introduces the pair to a local pub game called Aunt Sally and serves a local dish to a victorious Janet. She uncovers the history of Broughton Castle and Brian visits Wykham Park Farm at the height of the asparagus season to pick his own produce and use it to prepare a salad with radish dressing. Then, at Cumber Farm he encounters its herd of veal cattle, which provides the key ingredient for his celebration cook.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Exploring the London's surprising and secret wildlife, including seals, parakeets, badgers, foxes and even pelicans who have made London their home. The programme also focuses on the admirers of these animals, from Billingsgate fish porters and Indian chefs to Crayfish Bob, who scours the canals for foreign species.(n)

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: Life in the treacherous seas that surround the South American wilderness. The 4,000-mile coast stretches from the cold waters of Cape Horn - where rockhopper penguins overcome huge challenges to raise their young - to the far north's much warmer climate, where huge elephant seals battle for position in the heat of the desert. Orcas ram-raid the beaches, grabbing seal pups to feed their young, and fishermen are also incentivised to gather the sea's bounty. Narrated by Santiago Cabrera.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough profiles the tree-dwellers of the animal kingdom, as primates, bats and squirrels perform complicated manoeuvres in the world's forests. Whether aided by sharp claws, webbed feet or gripping tails, these animals play a complicated game of survival with predators lurking below, ready to make a meal of those who fail to stay aloft.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Beginning in the coastal town of Deal in Kent, Mark Stacey and Will Axon head west in search of collectibles, before battling it out at an auction in Chiswick, London. Each antiques expert will be hoping to make the most profit when their bargains go under the hammer.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the sixth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Allyson Felix will be chasing an incredible 10th World Championship gold in the 400m final this evening, while the likes of Kyron McMaster and Kerron Clement are expected to battle it out in the 400m hurdles final. In the field, the women's shot put final takes place and British medal hopeful Lorraine Ugen looks to qualify for the long jump final, while Mo Farah begins the defence of his 5,000m title in the heats. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jamie Bartlett investigates how technology companies are shaping the future of the world, and the potential negative consequences of the drive towards progress. He visits Hyderabad, where the utopian vision promoted by Uber has left many drivers on the brink of suicide, questions the impact of more jobs becoming automated, and meets a former executive who fears social breakdown and the collapse of capitalism.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Comedian and actor Adil Ray is the latest celebrity uncovering facts about his heritage in the genealogy documentary. The Citizen Kahn star's mother came to England from newly independent Kenya in 1967, and now he identifies himself as Muslim, Pakistani, African and Brummie. Adil heads to east Africa to find out more about his lineage, tracing his mixed Asian and African ancestry across Kenya to Uganda, meeting relatives for the first time in the traditional kingdom of Buganda and investigating a rumoured link to royalty.(n)

programme.title: Incredible Medicine: Dr Weston's Casebook
programme.desc: Gabriel Weston continues to unlock the secrets of the human body, investigating some of the most extraordinary cases in medicine. First, she hears the story of a man with bones much stronger than the norm, and a girl whose arm will not stop growing. Dr Weston also learns of a woman who became pregnant with twins, but in two separate wombs, and a woman with a condition that means she is able to get lost within her own home.(n)

programme.title: Fight Game: The McGuigans
programme.desc: Following the fortunes of the McGuigan family and their stable of boxers, including Carl Frampton, in their pursuit of glory in the most brutal of businesses. In the first episode, the team are in New York for Frampton's world title bout against Leo Santa Cruz.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Entertainment guru and Good Morning Britain star Richard Arnold joins Brian Conley on the sofa to talk about the television that shaped him, and there is a tribute to Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Keepers in charge of one of the planet's rarest animals get a fright and Jean Johansson joins Anne the elephant to see just how much water her trunk can hold.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw presents from the Westpoint Arena in Exeter as two people take on their former teacher and her husband, with help from experts Gary Pe and Charlie Ross.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: The Great British Bake Off 2015 champion Nadiya Hussain embarks on a culinary road trip around Britain, meeting with producers, farmers and fishermen across the country as she creates her own recipes inspired by their produce. In the first episode Nadiya begins her tour in the Home Counties, where she visits an asparagus farm in Oxford, before trying her hand at food smoking in Milton Keynes.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ally McGrath creates an inventive fish dish based on his summer memories of rock pooling in the River Tweed. Meanwhile, Angela Malik takes on the ancient skill of preparing sashimi, and defending regional winner Michael Bremner uses turbot for his meal, but which will impress the veteran chef?.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents a quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner head to the Oare Marshes in Kent, where they tour the ancient town of Faversham and explore the Goods Shed Farmers Market in Canterbury. Plus, chef Rafael Lopez uses local ingredients to create a lunch of lamb cutlets and vegetables.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: A journey around some of the most dramatic coastlines in Europe, uncovering the stories behind how these landscapes have shaped history.(n)

programme.title: Viva Las Vegas
programme.desc: A charismatic racing driver arrives in the city to prepare for its first grand prix. Unfortunately, his car has no engine, so to make the money to buy one he takes a job as a casino waiter. However, he loses focus when he falls in love, leaving a rival with the means to steal the race and his girl. Musical, starring Elvis Presley, who died 40 years ago on August 16, with Ann-Margret, Cesare Danova and William Demarest.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at vibrantly coloured monkeys in Venezuela, Costa Rica and West Africa. He encounters the red howler, which boasts one of the loudest calls in the wild, a capuchin that uses a tree as an anvil, the guenon, which communicates via facial expression, and the ground-dwelling gelada baboon.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Will Axon and Mark Stacey begin their journey in Crystal Palace, south London, before travelling to Piccadilly in the centre of the city to visit the home of the Kennel Club. They then make their way to the final auction in Southend-on-Sea, Essex, to see who can make the most profit from their haul.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the seventh night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. The women's 5,000m heats has strong British representation, with Laura Muir, Steph Twell and Eilish McColgan all looking to progress, while Katarina Johnson-Thompson looks to qualify for the high jump final four days after completing the heptathlon. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley. Coverage continues on BBC1. Live coverage of the USPGA Championship golf begins on the interactive service at 6pm.(n)

programme.title: 10 Puppies and Us
programme.desc: Emma Lowe goes in search of a special puppy, wanting one that will act as a therapy dog for her four-year-old son, who has Down's syndrome, and soothe him when he is distressed. Meanwhile, newlyweds Leigh and Bella are forced to call in behaviourist Louise Glazebrook when their new pug Butch Cassidy has trouble sleeping on a night. There are also catch-ups with salon owner Hannah, who is taking on her third Chihuahua, and psychic Delia as she welcomes the big-breed Leonberger she fell in love with. But as the small puppy grows, she finds herself completely out of her depth.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.sub-title: Top of the Lake: China Girl: Surrogate.
programme.desc: Robin is galvanised by her new theory about China Girl, taking her inquiry in an entirely new direction. She also begins to relish spending time with Mary - until the arrival of Al Parker from New Zealand threatens her precious new life in Sydney. Julia and Pyke are horrified to learn that Puss intends to marry their daughter, and begin to make their own investigations. But when their snooping leads to a very public confrontation, they are forced to turn to Robin for help. Crime drama, starring Elizabeth Moss, Nicole Kidman and Alice Englert.(n)

programme.title: Athletics: World Championships Highlights
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Ore Oduba present analysis of the seventh night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, where the finals of the men's 200m and triple jump, and women's 400m hurdles took place. Michael Johnson offers his input.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Golf: USPGA Championship
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents live coverage of the closing stages of day one at the fourth and final Major of the year, held at Quail Hollow Club in Charlotte, North Carolina. Commentary from Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Maureen Madill and Mark James. Live coverage begins on the interactive service at 6pm.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Tom Cunliffe tells the story of the LCVP, the Landing Craft, Vehicle, Personnel, which had a pivotal role in transporting troops during the Second World War, especially for beach landings. The writer and sailor goes aboard one of the few remaining examples to learn how this piece of machinery was developed and how it is best remembered for its part in D-Day. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Fair Isle: Living on the Edge
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary charting life on Britain's most remote inhabited island, which is home to 55 people and situated halfway between mainland Shetland and the Orkneys. A new couple settle in and adapt to island life, and cameras follow a family whose 11-year-old son has to leave home to board at secondary school on mainland Shetland.(n)

programme.title: In Search of Arcadia
programme.desc: Dr Janina Ramirez teams up with waterman and fellow historian John Bailey to explore the origins and ethos of the English Landscape movement, which sprang to life in the 12-mile stretch of the Thames between Hampton and Chiswick in the early 18th century. Devised by a group of writers, poets, artists and garden designers, the movement was inspired by the classical landscapes of antiquity, and the notion of Arcadia, an idealised land in which mankind lives in harmony with nature. Janina takes in some of the most famous examples of English Arcadian work, including Nicholas Poussin's painting Et in Arcadia Ego, and visits some of the movement's most notable landmarks, including Hampton Court Palace and Marble Hill House, and the view from Richmond Hill. Plus, John goes fishing on the Thames with Izaak Walton's Compleat Angler, which not only serves as a comprehensive guide to angling on the river, but also serves as a philosophical treatise on the Arcadian mindset.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Jane: Battle for the City
programme.desc: Documentary charting the impact of the work of Jane Jacobs, the journalist, author and activist whose incendiary book The Life and Death of Great American Cities sent shockwaves through the architectural and planning industries when it was published in 1960. Jacobs' book claimed that 20th-century urban planners were guilty of short-sightedness and intellectual arrogance in their pursuit of modernism at the expense of historic neighbourhoods across the US. This film explores how Jacobs famously championed this cause against `master builder' Robert Moses, whose urbanisation efforts in New York City stood in direct opposition to her ideals.(n)

programme.title: Scotland's Einstein: James Clerk Maxwell - The Man Who Changed the World
programme.desc: Professor Iain Stewart reveals the story behind James Clerk Maxwell, the Scottish physicist who has been dubbed as `Scotland's Einstein'. Despite his discoveries causing a revolution in physics and shaping the modern world, Maxwell is largely unknown outside his native land. Iain sets out to change that by celebrating his life, work and legacy, 150 years after his greatest work was published.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Waves
programme.desc: David Malone investigates the importance of ocean waves. He discovers they are not made of water, can travel sideways and their sound is created by bubbles, and examines the connection between the life cycles of waves and human beings.(n)

programme.title: Fair Isle: Living on the Edge
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary charting life on Britain's most remote inhabited island, which is home to 55 people and situated halfway between mainland Shetland and the Orkneys. A new couple settle in and adapt to island life, and cameras follow a family whose 11-year-old son has to leave home to board at secondary school on mainland Shetland.(n)

Janina takes in some of the most famous examples of English Arcadian work, including Nicholas Poussin's painting Et in Arcadia Ego, and visits some of the movement's most notable landmarks, including Hampton Court Palace and Marble Hill House, and the view from Richmond Hill. Plus, John goes fishing on the Thames with Izaak Walton's Compleat Angler, which not only serves as a comprehensive guide to angling on the river, but also serves as a philosophical treatise on the Arcadian mindset.(n)

programme.desc: Sam Willis traces the evolution of weaponry in Britain, beginning by getting to grips with the swords, lances and shields used on the battlefield 1,000 years ago.(n)

programme.title: Andrew Marr's The Making of Modern Britain
programme.desc: Andrew Marr provides an insight into Britain at the dawn of the 20th century, highlighting the key moments of the era with archive footage and vivid anecdotes. In the first instalment, he takes a look back at the country mourning the death of Queen Victoria, fighting against the Boers in South Africa, and enjoying the music hall. There are also stories of political intrigue, the beginning of the struggle for women's suffrage, and how a meeting between Mr Rolls and Mr Royce started a revolution in motoring.(n)

programme.title: Wilde
programme.desc: Biopic of author and acclaimed wit Oscar Wilde, focusing on his affair with Lord Alfred Douglas at a time when homosexual liaisons were illegal. Refusing to flee the country when their relationship was uncovered, he was subsequently jailed, enduring two years of hard labour. Starring Stephen Fry, Jude Law, Vanessa Redgrave and Jennifer Ehle.(n)
