programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will agrees to fire Karen's pastry chef - until he bakes a delicious love triangle for the three of them. Grace asks Jack to help launch Nick's scriptwriting career. American comedy, guest starring Ed Burns, with Eric McCormack and Megan Mullally.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray fears Debra will seek revenge after he embarrasses her at a school auction. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra's mother Lois comes to stay with the family for a week, but seems to be more interested in her crossword puzzles than in Ray or the children. Katherine Helmond guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The prospect of Christmas with his son Frederick leaves Frasier panicking about what presents to buy him, and it takes a reminder from Martin about the festive spirit to keep him on the right track.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: It's Hard to Say Goodbye If You Won't Leave.
programme.desc: The psychiatrist realises the true depth of his feelings for station manager Kate, only for her to announce she is moving to Chicago. Kelsey Grammer and Mercedes Ruehl star.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The psychiatrist suddenly realises he has a shortage of friends in Seattle, as most of his old ones are back in Boston. He announces on air he is looking for companionship and gets a lot more than he bargained for. Guest starring Griffin Dunne, with Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is forced to revise for a work assessment during the girls' trip to Las Vegas, and Amy and Bernadette accuse her of spoiling their fun. Meanwhile, the guys try to invent something of scientific importance - but only come up with new ways to procrastinate. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny ask Howard and Bernadette for advice when they argue about money. Meanwhile, Sheldon and Raj try to find out whether they could survive a dark matter research expedition in a salt mine by attempting to simulate the conditions in a steam tunnel beneath the university. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A dejected Mr Burns tries to improve his public image by taking part in a series of lowbrow radio talk shows and bringing the legendary Loch Ness monster to Springfield. With the voice of Michael McKean.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer becomes his local baseball team's mascot and does so well that a Major League side recruits him to help revive its flagging fortunes. Unfortunately, it is not long before he is fired. With the guest voice of Tony Bennett.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Car salesman Paul and his partner Sara, glamorous newlyweds Russell and Shane, and offbeat duo Janine and Neil compete to throw the best dinner party in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James tries to make an £85,000 deal on a modified sports car, while designer handbag expert Claudia heads to Germany to value a large collection of bags owned by a former New York socialite. A female bodybuilder wants to sell jewellery so she can fund her new hobby, and a golf fanatic brings in a case of vintage wine.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Helen Fospero presides in Dictionary Corner, alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: The jurors are three days in, and the game is getting serious. But Dan's competitive spirit may cause divisions in the ranks.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Linda and Alan Keir, who want to buy a holiday home to escape the climate of the Scottish Highlands. They look at five properties on their budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third host Peter Morris welcomes guests to the Pebbles B&B in Seaton, Devon, but despite his breakfast award, not all of the guests are impressed by his culinary offerings.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retail manager Yuno hosts the third evening in Cardiff, hoping to scoop the prize by giving his guests a taste of the Himalayas, as well as entertaining with traditional dancing.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Sideshow Bob thirsts for revenge on Krusty the Clown, vowing to kill his former employer for erasing tapes of the first 10 years of their TV show, and hypnotises Bart to do the dirty deed for him. Featuring the guest voices of Kelsey Grammer and Gary Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Hunter plans a surprise for Neeta, while the Donovans get an unexpected visit, and Marnie turns to Myra for support. Elsewhere, Cindy is in the throes of a manic episode after lying about getting her medication, but she is encouraged to speak to a doctor with Dirk, Holly and Alfie's support.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and Steve Jones host an appeal to rehome all the animals in Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter, attempting to encourage would-be owners to consider them first over buying a pet. Many more rescue centres across the country are also taking part, while Kate Quilton follows adoptions as they happen in real time.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Headteacher Emma arrives in resus having been in a collision with a bus while cycling home from the school she works at. As she is treated, her husband Mick reflects on being informed what had happened. Meanwhile, 33-year-old Josh is treated for severe back pain, and 87-year-old Pamela is examined for a possible blood clot in her leg, and tells the doctors about her childhood in London during the Blitz.(n)

programme.title: Eden
programme.desc: Boatman Anton and carpenter Raph find themselves ostracised by almost every other member of the Eden community, having built an isolated house in the woods. Anton bears the brunt of their frustrations and anger; as there is a widely-held belief that the pair are not contributing to the wider group, yet are using items earmarked for the whole community - something they deny. Oli decides to confront Raph and Anton - the resulting showdown boils over into a dramatic conclusion that changes the group for ever.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

programme.title: My Online Nightmare
programme.desc: This documentary explores some of the most extraordinary scammers and fraudsters who use the internet to lure and con their victims with terrifying, and sometimes deadly, results. This first episode examines astonishing cases of sex fraud, telling the stories of people who were tricked into thinking that the person they met online were someone completely different.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A poodle called Diamond has been referred for a total hip replacement, and another, with the same owner, needs a new knee. Noel Fitzpatrick operates on both dogs on the same day, and doesn't finish until 3am. Hopity, a 12-week-old Balinese kitten, has a deformity on one of her back legs, which she could end up losing, while the operation itself is a huge risk. Hazell has brought in Dandi, a five month-old German shepherd who is lame in both front legs.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zeke's, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. The new proprietors, husband and wife duo Darryl and Ellen Cortello, focused all the efforts on the financial side of things, so it is up to Gordon to show them that they first need to love food to make any profit.(n)

programme.title: Eden
programme.desc: Analysis of events during the short lived 2016 reality show continues, and as three more people leave, for the first time the men significantly outnumber the women in the Scottish camp. Some of the men suggest they concentrate on the traditionally more 'male' roles, while declaring the more domestic roles should be done by the women.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the Tees Valley in the north-east of England to find a property for first-time parents Nicola Moore and Tony Curry, who are desperate for a place together. They also offer expert advice to jewellery designer Emily Lathan and her graphic-designer boyfriend Dani Jones.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: In Leeds, Margaret is helped by daughter Sam to improve her home's kerb appeal, Dale and Maria need to reclaim their entire upstairs, while Les and Michelle need to warm up their cold blue hallway. All this to impress buyer Michelle, who has just three weeks to find a family home.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Soon-to-be parents Iman and Heather Ahmed want a vintage-inspired nursery for their baby, but Heather has never used a sewing machine. Can Kirstie help them create the bedroom that they dream of for their first child?.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Helen Fospero presides in Dictionary Corner, alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Jack and Will decide to buy a holiday home together in a new up-and-coming district, but discover the area is not as amenable to the gay community as they had imagined. American comedy, starring Eric McCormack and Sean Hayes.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will goads Grace into seeing his therapist, but is stricken with pangs of jealousy when he learns the two women have formed a close friendship. Meanwhile, Karen acquires a pair of glasses and begins to see everything more clearly - including Jack's many flaws. Sharon Stone guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra decides it is Ray's turn to take charge of birth control, but he backs out of having a vasectomy and buys a less drastic form of contraception - which Frank somehow mistakes for sweets. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Peter Boyle.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert grows tired of the lack of privacy at his parents' house and moves out, only to end up living with a couple who are uncannily similar to Marie and Frank.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Joe spends the night in Daphne's room, causing a shocked Frasier's mind to work overtime and Niles to become consumed by jealousy. Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce star.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles takes dancing lessons in preparation for a posh society ball, but his date falls ill at the last minute, so he asks Daphne to go with him instead. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: The Show Where Diane Comes Back.
programme.desc: Diane visits Seattle for the opening night of her new play, which turns out to be a mixed blessing for Frasier. Although hurt over being jilted, he still harbours feelings for her - but they disappear once he attends the dress rehearsal. Shelley Long guest stars.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is left in a difficult professional situation when a doctor (guest star Billy Bob Thornton) turns up at her door following her flirtatious sales technique, so the guys try to help her out. Meanwhile, Amy and Bernadette have a dispute over whether female scientists should flaunt their sexuality to try to get ahead at work. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang re-creates a prom night on the roof of the apartment building when the girls decide they would like to re-enact their evenings with their current partners. However, Sheldon feels under pressure to take part in all the romantic traditions, and Howard worries about who Stuart will bring as his date. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart runs away from home at Thanksgiving and ends up in a shelter for down-and-outs, where he is interviewed by a TV news crew - much to the horror of Homer and Marge.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Parental rivalry between the Simpsons and long-suffering neighbours the Flanders adds spice to a junior golf tournament as Bart and Todd go head to head. The two boys decide to throw the match by agreeing on a tie, but it is their fathers who pay the price.(n)

programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Cornwall compete to throw the perfect dinner party, with Zaya and Damian, Kelly and Jon, and Emma and Gavin battling it out for the £1,000 cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James hopes to sell a Second World War Tiger Moth biplane for £70,000, while two different diamond rings bought for £22,000 give the Prestige Pawnbrokers team a headache. programme.desc: Classic sidesplittingly funny comedy stars John Belushi as the head of the delinquent Delta House fraternity that the dean of Faber College plans to rid his campus of(n)

programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this clever, offbeat Western(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its oppressive faction system, Tris and Four lead a journey outside of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind(n)

programme.title: Manhunter
programme.desc: Dark thriller about an ex-FBI forensic investigator who is called in to track down a brutal serial killer known as 'the Tooth Fairy'. To help him understand the mind of his quarry, he visits the prison which holds an old adversary of his - notorious serial killer Dr Hannibal 'the Cannibal' Lektor. But the investigation comes to threaten his sanity and the lives of his family(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A thief enlists the help of mythical Egyptian gods to overthrow a vicious ruler(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Writer-director Paul W.S. Anderson's turbo-charged, slam-bang tune-up of Roger Corman's 1975 cult vehicle "Death Race 2000" follows the non-stop action taking place during a do-or-die contest pitting a convict (Jason Statham) against other cons, with the winner walking off with his freedom. Anderson admits to being "a big fan of the Corman movie," and this reworking is a glowing salute to Corman's original. Corman also serves as one of the film's producers, along with Anderson and Tom Cruise(n)

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: A ruthless warlord resolves to rid the desert of its few remaining tribes, prompting them to seek the help of a legendary assassin to end the despot's reign of terror by destroying his source of power - a beautiful but deadly sorceress. Fantasy action adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, Steven Brand, Kelly Hu and Michael Clarke Duncan(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant (Frank Grillo) who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate (Elizabeth Mitchell) who wants to end "the Purge." Written and directed by James DeMonaco(n)

programme.title: The Last Boy Scout
programme.desc: An ex-quarterback teams up with a down-on-his-luck PI whose quarry is murdered while he was supposed to be protecting her(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this clever, offbeat Western(n)

programme.title: Dead Presidents
programme.desc: Vivid account of a youth who finds few opportunities after returning from Vietnam, and plots to heist a truck carrying Federal Reserve money(n)

programme.title: Traders
programme.desc: A man's business goes under, threatening to derail his posh existence. In a desperate attempt to keep his life as he knows it, he agrees to cash out his entire life savings and put it all on the line in a diabolical, winner-takes-all fight to the death(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Comedy about a failed actor turned drama teacher who, in a final and deluded attempt to make an impact, sets about creating a controversial and 'inspirational' sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: This outlandish comedy set in the golden age of showbiz centers on a slick Hollywood fixer named Eddie Mannix, who is pressed into action when a superstar actor is kidnapped and held for ransom. Mannix must race to quietly collect the ransom money before the gossip mags catch wind of the scandal(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: The Johnsons set out from California for a family reunion in Missouri. The parents are split up, the kids are arguing - can everyone keep it together for the big day?(n)

programme.title: Rock Star
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars in this modern-day fairy tale about the lead singer of a heavy-metal tribute band who joins the real group when its front man quits, and immediately gets in way over his head in a dizzying world of sex, drugs, and rock and roll. Jennifer Aniston, Timothy Spall, Dominic West, Jason Bonham, Timothy Olyphant, Jason Flemyng(n)

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
programme.desc: Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Lucy Liu reprise their roles in this dazzling stunt-filled sequel, in which the trio takes on a former Angel who has gone over to the dark side(n)

programme.title: Puerto Ricans in Paris
programme.desc: Two Puerto Rican NYC cops (Luis Guzman and Edgar Garcia) are asked by a pair of French fashion designers (Alice Taglioni and Frederic Anscombre) to come to Paris to hunt down the counterfeiters who stole a couture handbag. Rosie Perez and Rosario Dawson co-star. Directed by Ian Edelman(n)

programme.title: National Security
programme.desc: The mismatched cops variation of the buddy comedy genre gets taken out of mothballs for this farce directed by longtime Adam Sandler collaborator Dennis Dugan. Martin Lawrence and Steve Zahn star, respectively, as Earl Montgomery, a loudmouthed police academy reject, and Hank Rafferty, a mild-mannered cop who is disgraced and dismissed from his job. Having met once before on a traffic stop, the two men are less than thrilled to be paired together as security guards. When the two men discover a complex smuggling scheme, however, they put aside their animosity to investigate the criminal scheme. They soon learn that the illegal enterprise involves a mastermind named Nash (Eric Roberts) and a new, virtually indestructible metal that's worth a fortune. Unable to persuade Hank's former police department superiors that they're onto a huge case, the two partners must devise a way to expose the sophisticated scam and bring down Nash on their own. National Security co-stars Colm Feore, Bill Duke, Timothy Busfield, and Wayne Knight(n)

programme.title: The Omen
programme.desc: After his wife gives birth to a stillborn child, the American ambassador to Britain switches two kids in their hospital cribs. What he doesn't know is that little Damien is the Anti-Christ. Seminal 70s horror(n)

programme.title: Reign Of Fire
programme.desc: A survivalist (Christian Bale) teams up with a military man (Matthew McConaughey) to slay fire-breathing dragons in postapocalyptic 2020(n)

programme.title: Incarnate
programme.desc: In this terrifying horror thriller, an unconventional exorcist battles a malevolent demon that has taken over an innocent 11-year-old boy. Later, he learns that the paranormal entity is also responsible for the deaths of his wife and child(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: Academy Award-winning Exorcist director William Friedkin scuttles deep into the darkest recesses of the traumatized human psyche with this tale of a lonely bartender haunted by the long-ago disappearance of her young son, and the paranoia that emerges when she enters into a tentative relationship with a deeply disturbed drifter. Adapted from the off-Broadway play by Tracy Letts, Bug centers on Agnes (Ashley Judd), who tends bar alongside pal R.C. (Lynn Collins), and has recently moved into a shoddy roadside motel in hopes of avoiding her menacing and recently paroled ex-husband, Jerry (Harry Connick Jr.). Upon making the acquaintance of subdued former soldier Peter (Michael Shannon, repeating his stage role), a veteran of the first Gulf War, Agnes finally senses that things are looking up. Quietly charming despite his melancholy aura, Peter soon reveals to Agnes that he contracted a "bug" while serving in the Middle East, and that it may have been deliberately administered as part of a secret military medical experiment. Convinced that the microscopic insects are quickly multiplying just under the surface of his skin and that they have now infected Agnes as well, Peter soon descends into a psychotic rage as he resorts to increasingly desperate measures to purge himself of the offending subdermal arthropods(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law) in this sidesplitting action comedy. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials

programme.desc: The mismatched cops variation of the buddy comedy genre gets taken out of mothballs for this farce directed by longtime Adam Sandler collaborator Dennis Dugan. Martin Lawrence and Steve Zahn star, respectively, as Earl Montgomery, a loudmouthed police academy reject, and Hank Rafferty, a mild-mannered cop who is disgraced and dismissed from his job. Having met once before on a traffic stop, the two men are less than thrilled to be paired together as security guards. When the two men discover a complex smuggling scheme, however, they put aside their animosity to investigate the criminal scheme. They soon learn that the illegal enterprise involves a mastermind named Nash (Eric Roberts) and a new, virtually indestructible metal that's worth a fortune. Unable to persuade Hank's former police department superiors that they're onto a huge case, the two partners must devise a way to expose the sophisticated scam and bring down Nash on their own. programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia(n)

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted--or rather, refereed--by boxing expert Max Kellerman, this lively cable-TV discussion show featured four sports columnists, each from a different part of the USA, discussing recent pro-athletic developments in a sort of electronic summit meeting. Kellerman determined how much time each of the columnists would be permitted to express his or her opinions--and he was harsh indeed, frequently limiting the discourse to ten seconds or less. At the end of the show, Kellerman would award points for the most cogent opinions and arguments, and also subtract points from contributors whom he determined had not effectively expressed themselves. The inagural episode of ESPN's Around the Horn was seen on September 30, 2002(n)

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Mike Wilbon face off in this half-hour debate. The journalists take two minutes to argue each point, and haggle their way through a variety of sports news(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: Explorer Paul Rose, environmentalist Philippe Cousteau Jr, maritime archaeologist Dr Lucy Blue and marine biologist Tooni Mahto base themselves in the Bahamas to explore the Atlantic. On the island of Andros, they go on a risky dive to discover what the oceans looked like 3.5 billion years ago, and investigate an underwater cave system thought to hold the remains of the first inhabitants.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Documentary picking up where the Walking with Dinosaurs series left off, imagining life on Earth 16 million years after dinosaurs became extinct. Kenneth Branagh narrates as computer graphics give a new lease of life to the creatures that battled for supremacy throughout this turbulent age. The first episode re-animates the `walking whale' and a fearsome half-tonne flightless bird known as a gastornis.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Computer graphics give a new lease of life to the basilosaurus, a mighty carnivorous whale that occupied an ancient waterway connecting Asia to the Atlantic. Here it is seen desperately foraging for food to sustain its unborn calf, leading to a battle for survival against a rival species. Also featured is the andrewsarchus, a monstrous wolf-like mammal, and the large aquatic pig known as moeritherium.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall's journey brings him into contact with more candidates for his list of Earth's deadliest creatures - the paralysis tick, lace monitor lizard and redback spider.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall dives with yellow-fin tuna to demonstrate their speed.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

Kenneth Branagh narrates as computer graphics give a new lease of life to the creatures that battled for supremacy throughout this turbulent age. The first episode re-animates the `walking whale' and a fearsome half-tonne flightless bird known as a gastornis.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Computer graphics give a new lease of life to the basilosaurus, a mighty carnivorous whale that occupied an ancient waterway connecting Asia to the Atlantic. Here it is seen desperately foraging for food to sustain its unborn calf, leading to a battle for survival against a rival species. Also featured is the andrewsarchus, a monstrous wolf-like mammal, and the large aquatic pig known as moeritherium.(n)

programme.title: Breaking Ice
programme.desc: Documentary strand following scientists and researchers on board icebreakers as they take part in important research. In the first programme, the Polarstern is caught in high winds.(n)

programme.title: Breaking Ice
programme.desc: The geophysicists deploy their seismometers in rough seas.(n)

programme.title: Bahama Blue
programme.desc: Looking at species including Oceanic whitetip sharks, sperm whales and Blainesville's beaked whales as they survive in the open water in the Bahamas.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall's journey brings him into contact with more candidates for his list of Earth's deadliest creatures - the paralysis tick, lace monitor lizard and redback spider.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall dives with yellow-fin tuna to demonstrate their speed.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary strand following scientists and researchers on board icebreakers as they take part in important research. In the first programme, the Polarstern is caught in high winds.(n)

programme.title: Breaking Ice

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: Explorer Paul Rose, environmentalist Philippe Cousteau Jr, maritime archaeologist Dr Lucy Blue and marine biologist Tooni Mahto base themselves in the Bahamas to explore the Atlantic. On the island of Andros, they go on a risky dive to discover what the oceans looked like 3.5 billion years ago, and investigate an underwater cave system thought to hold the remains of the first inhabitants.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: Examining the behaviour of some of the world's most intelligent creatures.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The first of two episodes exploring the Indian Ocean, which accounts for 13 per cent of Earth's surface and covers 26 million square miles. The expedition visits a `coral nursery', one of the few places in the world where an extraordinary technique is being used to repair damaged reefs. Paul Rose and the team also head to a small community in Mozambique where shark fishing is an established practice.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: The life cycle of the indricothere, a distant relative of the rhino, which grew up to seven metres tall, making it the largest land animal ever to have lived. Narrated by Kenneth Branagh.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Reanimating Australopitheci, one of the first apes to walk upright and considered by anthropologists to be among humankind's earliest forebears. This documentary follows the fortunes of a tribe as its members wander the Ethiopian plains in search of a new home. Along the way they encounter weird and wonderful beasts, the most terrible of which is a sabre-toothed cat with a taste for simian flesh. Narrated by Kenneth Branagh.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: In Australia's Northern Territories, Steve Backshall encounters one of nature's most deadly predators - the saltwater crocodile.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall heads for India, where he goes on the trail of the saw-scaled viper. He also gets too close to the razor-sharp claws of the sloth bear.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Ngogo forest in Uganda, to study the largest chimpanzee group in the world defending their territory. The parasitic fungi cordyceps and creatures including the flying colugo, red crab spiders and blue birds of paradise are also observed by the naturalist in jungles around the world.(n)

programme.title: Breaking Ice
programme.desc: On board the Polarstern, Daniel Zitterbart tests a new thermal whale detection system.(n)

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: (2002) Martin Scorsese's multi-Oscar-nominated epic stars Daniel Day-Lewis as William Cutting, the leader of a violent gang in 19th-century New York who take on their rivals, led by "Priest" Vallon (Liam Neeson). Vallon dies and his young son Amsterdam disappears, only to return a man (Leonardo DiCaprio) torn between a thirst for revenge and a fascination for the charismatic Cutting, with Cameron Diaz as Jenny Everdeane, the pickpocket they both love(n)

programme.title: Transmitter Test
programme.desc: No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Kingdom Come
programme.desc: Bud Slocumb was "mean as a snake, and surly," according to his widow Raynelle, who gathers the whole family for a big reunion. Warm comedy, with relatives who steal, sleep, swear and fart(n)

programme.title: Stargate
programme.desc: An expert translates hieroglyphs on an ancient ring, which turn out to be a map to a portal to another world. The Army sends two men to pass through the stargate and report back what is on the other side(n)

programme.title: Philadelphia
programme.desc: Jonathan Demme brought the subject of AIDS into the Hollywood mainstream with the story of attorney Andrew Beckett, whose fast-track career is ended when his employers discover that he is HIV-positive. When Beckett decides to sue his former employers, the only other lawyer willing to take on the case is a homophobe played by Denzel Washington(n)

programme.title: Spanglish
programme.desc: A Hispanic woman and her young daughter are thrown into the middle of a well-to-do but remarkably dysfunctional family in this comedy drama from writer and director James L. Brooks. Flor (Paz Vega) is a single mother who has struggled to support her daughter Cristina (Shelbie Bruce) working as a domestic in Mexico. Hoping to give her daughter greater financial security, Flor packs up their belongings and moves the family to California, but Flor refuses to surrender her Latino identity and opts not to learn English; meanwhile, Cristina quickly learns to speak the language fluently. Flor lands a high-paying job working as a housekeeper for Deborah Clasky (Téa Leoni); Deborah doesn't speak a word of Spanish, but this is hardly the most curious thing about their working relationship. A deeply troubled neurotic who has spent time in a mental hospital, Deborah is at once obsessed with her duties as a wife and mother and utterly clueless to her family's needs, and when she learns that Flor has a daughter, she insists that the girl move in with the Claskys. Flor, however, isn't so sure she wants Deborah Americanizing Cristina, especially when Deborah begins doting on the girl at the expense of her relationship with her own daughter, Bernice (Sarah Steele). Deborah's husband, John (Adam Sandler), is an oasis of loving calm and understanding in the midst of his chaotic family, and Flor becomes attracted to this man who shows no signs of the arrogant machismo she's accustomed to. But John's career as a chef is turned upside down when The New York Times gives his restaurant a four-star review, suddenly turning his small eatery into the "in" spot in Los Angeles. Meanwhile, Flor reaches the end of her patience when Deborah enrolls Cristina into an exclusive private school which Flor is certain will turn her into a typical American child and drive a wedge between Cristina and her mother. Spanglish also stars Cloris Leachman as Deborah's sharp-tongued mother(n)

programme.title: Tomorrow Never Dies
programme.desc: Action adventure which marks Pierce Brosnan's second outing as superspy James Bond. A media baron sets about triggering a third world war so that his 24-hour news network can profit from exclusive coverage. As an international crisis looms, Bond is shaken from his extracurricular duties and stirred into action in a head-spinning cocktail of set pieces which climax mid-ocean on the villain's floating HQ(n)

programme.title: Gangs of New York

programme.title: The X-Files
programme.desc: Big-screen version of the hit sci-fi series about two FBI agents who investigate cases that defy rational explanation. The agents are closer than they have ever been to proving the existence of extraterrestrial life but there are forces out there desperate to stop them. The massive cover-up that ensues leads the duo from the desert of Texas to a remote outpost in the frozen wilderness before they discover the truth(n)

programme.title: The World Is Not Enough
programme.desc: Suave British secret agent James Bond is embroiled in an all-action race to defuse an international power struggle as the world's oil supply hangs in the balance. Following the murder of a tycoon, 007 becomes bodyguard to the tycoon's daughter, who has been targeted by a psychotic terrorist(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: One-Love. Reggie considers repping a talented college prospect with a shot at playing in the NFL, while M-Chuck gets involved with a pregnant young woman(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: The Dagger. Chen launches a big event to promote Cam's shoe line, but his actual plan is to woo Cassie, while Cam's interactions with a reporter don't work out as he planned(n)

programme.title: Phantoms
programme.desc: Two sisters enter an isolated mountain town, only to discover that the entire population, save for the sheriff, his deputy and a history professor, has been ravaged by giant wormlike creatures who feed on human flesh. Based on the novel by Dean Koontz. Peter O'Toole, Rose McGowan, Joanna Going, Liev Schreiber, Nicky Katt, Ben Affleck(n)

programme.title: Traitor
programme.desc: An FBI agent suspects a Muslim ex-US Special Operations officer of being involved with terrorists in this complex espionage thriller(n)

programme.title: Double Jeopardy
programme.desc: In this thriller, Ashley Judd plays Elizabeth Parsons, who is convicted of murdering her husband and sentenced to a long stretch in prison. After Elizabeth has spent six years behind bars, it turns out that her husband is still alive: he faked his own death as part of an insurance scam, and Elizabeth is soon released. However, Elizabeth's feelings for her husband can hardly be described as warm, and she wants custody of her son. Elizabeth's parole officer (Tommy Lee Jones) wonders if she might try to make his murder a real thing after all, especially since the law states a person cannot be convicted of the same crime twice. Double Jeopardy was directed by Bruce Beresford, from a screenplay by Douglas S. Cook and David Weisberg(n)

programme.title: One Fine Day
programme.desc: Hollywood heart-throbs Michelle Pfeiffer and George Clooney fall for one another in this old-fashioned romantic New York comedy about a pair of mismatched professionals. Melanie Parker (Pfeiffer) is a single parent and professional architect who somehow manages to combine the skills of her high-flying career with those of a supermum to her young son. Jack Taylor (Clooney), meanwhile, is a newspaper columnist who takes custody of his daughter every other weekend. On this particular fine day, Melanie, Jack and their children are going to be thrown together by circumstance for one chaotic day in which they will lose each other, miss meetings, jeopardise their careers - and find true love!(n)

programme.title: The World Is Not Enough
programme.desc: Suave British secret agent James Bond is embroiled in an all-action race to defuse an international power struggle as the world's oil supply hangs in the balance. Following the murder of a tycoon, 007 becomes bodyguard to the tycoon's daughter, who has been targeted by a psychotic terrorist(n)

programme.title: The X-Files
programme.desc: Big-screen version of the hit sci-fi series about two FBI agents who investigate cases that defy rational explanation. The massive cover-up that ensues leads the duo from the desert of Texas to a remote outpost in the frozen wilderness before they discover the truth(n)

programme.title: The Best of Times
programme.desc: Small-town banker Robin Williams has never been able to live down the fact that he dropped an important pass during a crucial high-school football game. Likewise tainted for life is the team's star quarterback Kurt Russell, now a garage owner. Fed up with living his life under a cloud, Williams hits upon a brilliant idea: he will stage a rematch-13 years after the fact--with the members of the rival team. Trouble beckons when Williams' father-in-law announces that he's rooting for the opposition. Williams is determined to win, and in pursuit of that goal he pushes his former teammates to hitherto untapped brilliance. Directed by Roger Spottiswood, The Best of Times was written by Ron Shelton, future writer/director of such delightful sports films as Bull Durham, White Men Can't Jump and Tin Cup; it was Shelton, in fact, who directed most of Best of Times' climactic football game(n)

programme.title: A Good Year
programme.desc: In this charming and romantic tale, a workaholic London investment broker inherits a vineyard in France, and finds his life changing for the better(n)

programme.title: Step Brothers
programme.desc: Two spoilt middle-aged men who still live at home become stepbrothers when their parents marry. Forced to share a bedroom and look for jobs together, the pair eventually forge a friendship. But can the family's domestic situation ever be harmonious?(n)

programme.title: Moonraker
programme.desc: British agent James Bond investigates the disappearance of an Anglo-American space shuttle which has fallen into the hands of a billionaire megalomaniac intent on world domination. Along the way, Bond has to contend with giant, steel-toothed hitman Jaws before stowing away on a flight to a space station being used as a colony to breed a genetically pure race(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: The Injury. While Cam deals with a potentially career-ending injury, he meets a woman who could be Miss Right; and Reggie begins to think he made a mistake taking on Jupitor as a client(n)

programme.title: Survivor's Remorse
programme.desc: The Date. A smitten Cam plans a very special first date with Allison, while Uncle Julius goes on a disturbing ride with the police and M-Chuck uses her therapy revelations to drive her mother on a guilt trip(n)

programme.title: Summer School
programme.desc: Director Carl Reiner takes the chalk-and-cheese romantic comedy and takes it into the classroom. Mark Harmon is a high school teacher stuck with a summer teaching remedial English to a bunch of misfits while just down the hall is fellow teacher Kirstie Alley who loathes his and his methods equally. But as the summer wears on and, by hook and crook, Harmon manages to dun information into his charges (though not without various disasters), so her attitude starts to mellow(n)

programme.title: Quarantine
programme.desc: A news reporter and her cameraman are assigned to spend an evening shift with the Los Angeles fire service, when a routine call takes them to an incident in an apartment block. Once there they hear blood-curdling screams which lead them to a rabid woman, but on trying to escape they find the building has been sealed and they are now quarantined with a host of murderous infected tenants(n)

programme.desc: Shrill fantasy about bickering brothers (Jonah Bobo, Josh Hutcherson) who are propelled into outer space by playing a mysterious board game. Based on the children's book by Chris Van Allsburg. Directed by Jon Favreau ("Elf")(n)

programme.title: Masters of the Universe
programme.desc: Dolph Lundgren stars in this live-action film version of the popular television cartoon series (based on a collection of Mattel action figures). Lundgren is He-Man, a well-muscled super-hero, battling the evil Skeletor (Frank Langella) for control of the universe. Skeletor has designs on conquering the planet Eternia, a ravaged utopia ruled over by the Sorceress of Greyskull Castle (Christina Pickles). He-Man is summoned to stop Skeletor's plans. But when the wily dwarf Gwildor (Billy Barty) utilizes his Cosmic Key, He-Man and Skeletor finds themselves transported to California. There, a waitress named Julie (Courteney Cox) and her boyfriend Kevin (Robert Duncan Mitchell) come across the Cosmic Key and become embroiled in the intergalactic battle between He-Man and Skeletor(n)

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: Sean Connery, Donald Sutherland and Lesley-Anne Down star in this true-life action thriller, based on director/screenwriter Michael Crichton's best-selling novel, about a daring gold heist that shocked Victorian society(n)

programme.title: The Double O Kid
programme.desc: A teen transports a package coveted by computer-virus creators(n)

programme.title: Pumpkinhead II: Blood Wings
programme.desc: A small-town cop has more to deal with than petty crime when his rebellious daughter resurrects the demonic Pumpkinhead(n)

programme.title: Something Beneath
programme.desc: A priest-turned-environmental activist discovers a deadly beast lurking beneath the hotel where an ecological summit is being held, and he embarks on a mission to dispose of the creature before it preys on the guests(n)

programme.title: Best of the Best 3: No Turning Back
programme.desc: The action series continues, as Tommy Lee takes on a group of neo-Nazis in the American heartland(n)

programme.title: Fortress
programme.desc: A glossy high-tech, futuristic sci-fi exterior does little to conceal the fact that this gory actioner is little more than a cliche-ridden prison movie--a movie that found tremendous popularity internationally. Set amidst an overpopulated, oppressed future U.S., it centers on the struggles of a defiant young couple who decide to have a second baby after the first dies. Unfortunately, the law states that each woman can only have one child. It is irrelevant whether the child survives or not. The couple attempts to make it safely out of the country, but they are captured and sentenced to spend three decades in the dreaded, corporate-owned Fortress, a grim place where lasers replace iron bars and inmates are controlled via radio-operated pain-inflicting intestinal devices. Incorrigible prisoners are forced to have their identities erased by a "mind wipe" machine. The prison is controlled by a sadistic cyborg warden and a robot army. The warden wants to make the woman's baby into a cyborg too. The warden also finds the wife very attractive. Meanwhile the husband begins making friends with his cellmate in hopes of finding a way to disable the surveillance system in time to save his wife and somehow escape(n)

programme.title: Revenge of the Ninja
programme.desc: Sho Kosugi plays Cho, a highly-accomplished ninja master who has sworn off his ninja ways and is living in L.A. Trouble follows him, however, because a bunch of ninja ne'er-do-wells threaten to kill his few family members and he must defend them. He takes a bunch of bad guys on and eradicates them(n)

programme.title: American Ninja
programme.desc: In the torrid heart of the Philippine jungle, a humble US Army private suddenly develops legendary skills and stealth. Believing he is the possessor of ancient martial artistry, he takes on the fearsome Black Ninja in a final duel(n)

programme.title: American Ninja 2: The Confrontation
programme.desc: Michael Dudikoff and Steve James stalk a drug kingpin who preys on marines. Larry Poindexter. Burke: Gary Conway(n)

programme.title: American Ninja 3: Blood Hunt
programme.desc: This, the third issue in the American Ninja series, stars karate expert David Bradley who goes to Japan for ninja training so he'll be able to avenge his father's murder. Once trained, he enters in an international karate contest held by some no-goods who'd like to get their hands on the world's toughest fella so they can try out a new artificial disease they've created. (They figure the best way to test the disease is upon the toughest guy they can find.) Most action occurs on a Caribbean island(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Highly strung method actor David Ruskin (guest star Stanley Tucci) researches a role by studying Adrian's mannerisms, but becomes so immersed in his personality that he develops an obsession with solving Trudy's murder. Tony Shalhoub stars.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Other Woman.
programme.desc: Stottlemeyer suspects a pretty blonde named Monica Waters is guilty of three murders - but Adrian is struck by her odd resemblance to his late wife Trudy and refuses to believe she could be guilty of foul play. Tony Shalhoub stars.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Marathon Man.
programme.desc: A woman is murdered while the San Francisco Marathon is taking place, and Monk suspects her married lover is to blame - even though he was one of the competitors and somehow managed to be registered at all checkpoints during the race. Tony Shalhoub stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: As Brenda and Fritz's wedding day approaches, one is preoccupied with a murder case and the other with the search for a drug lord. Starring Kyra Sedgwick and Jon Tenney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: As Brenda and the team investigate the quadruple murder of a family, they find themselves in the middle of an FBI case that could have a connection to the victims. Meanwhile, Provenza's good mood takes a turn for the worse. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick and GW Bailey.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The two Marine brothers of a sailor battling leukaemia are killed in the line of duty, and to spare the servicemen's family further grief, the secretary of the US Navy seeks the NCIS team's help in locating a suitable bone marrow donor. Meanwhile, Bishop returns home to Oklahoma for Thanksgiving. Military crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky is assaulted by a man who claims to have previously undisclosed information about his half-brother, who died decades ago. While his NCIS colleagues traces the attacker's whereabouts, Dr Mallard recalls the emotional final days he spent with his sibling. Elsewhere, as the holiday season approaches, Bishop and Jake discuss the future of their relationship. Naval crime drama, starring David McCallum.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Sharona's son Benjy witnesses a murder at a resort hotel, but cannot make anyone believe him except Adrian, who investigates the case with the help of an over-enthusiastic house detective. Guest starring Polly Draper (thirtysomething).(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: A wealthy businessman is apparently killed in an earthquake, but Adrian is sure that he was murdered by his wife, and sets out to investigate. Unfortunately, it is not long before the trauma of an aftershock deprives him of the power of speech.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A rich businessman being investigated for investment fraud is allegedly kidnapped, but Brenda and the team suspect he may have staged his own abduction. Starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: After David shoots an unarmed murder suspect, investigator Sharon Raydor is brought in to carry out an internal inquiry and Brenda soon finds herself at odds with the newcomer. Detective drama, starring Corey Reynolds and Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The first instalment of a two-part crossover with NCIS: New Orleans sees the Washington, DC team co-operating with their colleagues from the Big Easy to investigate a spate of lethal poisonings on board a New Orleans-to-DC flight. All the evidence seems to point to missing chef Luca, who happens to be Abby's brother, so the two investigative services join forces to locate him, and find out why a private tech firm seems to have been targetted by the killer. Naval crime drama, guest starring Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The concluding instalment of a two-part crossover with the original NCIS series sees Sebastian joining Abby Sciuto in Washington, DC to pick through the forensic evidence relating to the aircraft murders. Meanwhile, DC agent Ellie Bishop heads to New Orleans to help Pride and his team track down the chief suspect - Abby's brother Luca. Naval crime drama, guest starring Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Torres discovers a witness in an NCIS case is wanted by US Immigration and Customs Enforcement, while Abby, Bishop and McGee hope to sublet Tony's apartment - by wooing his father.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: Connections are drawn between a man facing vehicular manslaughter charges, and a corrupt state assemblyman who would greatly benefit from a guilty verdict.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: You Can't Do That on Television, Peter.
programme.desc: Peter's favourite TV programme is cancelled, prompting him to take matters into his own hands and create a new series for children - in which he has the starring role. Meanwhile, Meg begins an internship with Dr Hartman at the hospital.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie meets a kindred spirit who shares his love of advanced weaponry, and Lois buys twin beds when she grows tired of being crushed by Peter, who subsequently struggles to fall asleep without a night-time cuddle. With guest star Cate Blanchett.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan and Francine's social life gets a boost when they meet adventurous couple Tom and Cami, but they realise they cannot keep up with them. However, it isn't long before they devise a plan to slow them down permanently.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger invites Stan to attend one of his acting classes, but tempers flare when they both audition for the same role. Meanwhile, Steve and his friends plan to say goodbye to their childhoods by arranging the greatest sleepover ever.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie and Chris go missing, prompting Lois to ask a psychic for help - but the family's obsession with the paranormal goes too far. Meanwhile, Chris develops a crush on a girl at school.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie auditions in drag for his favourite TV show after discovering it is only searching for girls, and soon becomes a hit with viewers. Meg shocks the entire city by dating a conventionally attractive boy.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan finds out his half-brother Rusty (guest voice Lou Diamond Phillips) is wealthier than him when the family gathers for Thanksgiving, and takes extreme measures to recover what he thinks is rightfully his.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is awaiting his annual jury summons, but there is trouble ahead when becomes the foreman in a trial where Roger is the defendant. Meanwhile, Jeff and Hayley move in with the Smiths, and Francine tries to get Jeff to clean up his act.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Chris attend a fat camp, where they encounter a serial killer who targets overweight children, and Stewie becomes terrified of the robot on the cover of Queen album News of the World.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Joe, Brian and Quagmire are left to rediscover their own identities when they wake up following a seemingly innocent boys' night out to find their memories have been erased and Quahog is deserted.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: For Whom the Sleigh Bell Tolls.
programme.desc: Against Francine's advice, Stan decides to give Steve a gun for Christmas, but when the teenager accidentally shoots Santa dead, the whole festive season is under threat.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The Smiths are forced to move into a hotel following an incident in which Roger released lethal gas into their home. However, Francine soon becomes bored with her new surroundings and decides to assume the identity of a businesswoman.(n)

programme.desc: Country singer Willie Nelson is wrongly accused of murder - but fortunately Adrian is one of his biggest fans and resolves to prove him innocent. To complicate matters, the prosecution has a witness - a blind woman who claims she can identify the culprit by his voice.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Forced to make a nerve-racking cross-country flight with Sharona, a nervous Adrian whiles away the anxiety of the journey by studying his fellow passengers - and soon concludes that the Frenchman sitting across the aisle has just murdered his wife. Tony Shalhoub stars, with a guest appearance by his wife Brooke Adams.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and her squad are seconded into the FBI when a missing persons case turns into a murder investigation involving drug trafficking at parties, giving the deputy chief and Fritz the chance to work together again. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The team faces a difficult task when it investigates the murder of a reformed gang member. The people of the neighbourhood are sceptical and wary of the officers' presence, despite the fact that solving the crime could bring the inhabitants together. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team suspects foul play when a seaman who was set to testify before a grand jury dies before he can make his court appearance. When it becomes clear the man was murdered, the subsequent investigation reveals that a previously thwarted human-trafficking ring has been re-established. Meanwhile, a storm causes a massive power outage, and McGee seeks a room for the night among his colleagues. Naval crime drama, starring Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A deep-sea diver is murdered on the job, and his co-workers all become suspects. However, when they return to the surface, they must remain in a high-tech decompression chamber for four days. With each of their suspects confined within a tank, the NCIS team must complete an unorthodox investigation from the outside. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart the Genius. Academics have never been a priority for Bart Simpson (voice of Nancy Cartwright), and when Mrs. Krabappel (voice of Marcia Wallace) hands out a standardized IQ test that will "merely determine your future social stature and financial success," Bart hedges his bets by swiping a test from class brain Martin Prince (voice of Russi Taylor) and putting his name on it. Bart is as surprised as anyone when "his" test results confirm he has a genius IQ (while Martin is revealed to not be especially bright), and suddenly the school's staff decides Bart's rebellious behavior and previous poor grades were merely a product of boredom and dissatisfaction. Bart is transferred from Springfield Elementary to the Enriched Learning Center for Gifted Children, and he discovers his father Homer (voice of Dan Castellaneta) has a new respect and admiration for him. But Bart finds life among the super-intelligent is rough sledding, and his brighter sister Lisa (voice of Yeardley Smith) has a hard time believing her brother is a genius. "Bart the Genius" was first aired on January 14, 1990(n)

However, the youngest member of the Tracy family and his friends are still on the base, and it is down to them to save the day. Sci-fi adventure based on the 1960s puppet show, with Bill Paxton, Ben Kingsley and Anthony Edwards.(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries

Family comedy, starring Anne Hathaway, Julie Andrews, Heather Matarazzo and Hector Elizondo.(n)

programme.title: The Eagle

Accompanied by his British slave, he makes a dangerous journey north of Hadrian's Wall into the Scottish Highlands, territory occupied by hostile tribes. Action adventure, starring Channing Tatum, Jamie Bell, Mark Strong and Donald Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: The Way Back
programme.desc: Siberian gulag prisoners stage a daring escape during the Second World War. Refusing to live under Stalin's rule, they embark on a gruelling 4,500-mile journey across inhospitable terrain to escape the Soviet Union. Peter Weir's drama, starring Ed Harris, Colin Farrell, Saoirse Ronan, Jim Sturgess and Mark Strong.(n)

programme.title: The League of Gentlemen's Apocalypse
programme.desc: The town of Royston Vasey is facing destruction, as its creators plan to move on to other projects. However, their freakish inventions are not about to take oblivion lying down and journey into the real world to put things right. Surreal black comedy, starring Steve Pemberton, Mark Gatiss and Reece Shearsmith, alongside Michael Sheen, David Warner, Bernard Hill, Simon Pegg and Peter Kay.(n)

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: Withdrawn, mute 10-year-old Philip is ignored by his parents and goes off to explore Dartmoor alone, where he meets a retired colonel who shares his knowledge of Devon's wildlife. Under the older man's nurturing tutelage, the boy begins to tame a wild white colt, but fate proffers a series of setbacks just as real progress is being made. Children's drama, starring John Mills, Mark Lester, Sylvia Syms and Bernard Miles.(n)

programme.title: Millions

However, his level-headed brother realises they must race against time to spend the loot before the country switches to the Euro and a robber on their tail catches up with them. Comedy drama, starring Alex Etel, Lewis McGibbon, Daisy Donovan and James Nesbitt.(n)

programme.title: Dr Seuss' The Lorax

The hermit tells the story of a grumpy forest creature who tried to stop him destroying the trees, and inspires the youngster to undo the damage that has been done. Animated fantasy based on the children's book, with the voices of Danny DeVito, Zac Efron and Ed Helms.(n)

programme.title: Chasing Mavericks

programme.title: I, Robot

Sci-fi thriller, inspired by the Isaac Asimov stories, starring Will Smith, Bridget Moynahan and Alan Tudyk.(n)

programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef explains the value of pickling and preserving home-grown produce and explains why knowledge of these processes has been of vital importance throughout history. programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver seeks the authentic tastes of Spain in Andalucia. He makes paella for the whole town of Ronda, birthplace of modern bullfighting, and is taught how to cut serrano ham by an award-winning father and son team. programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Tom and Diana investigate a spate of mysterious thefts at Bayview, and Tom ends up facing a shoplifting charge - but Diana decides to defend him.(n)

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: Tom opts for a policy of complete honesty at all times, while Diana tries to cope with her niece, the `Clapham Strangler'. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole and Graham Crowden.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin discovers his house is built over the route of a disused public footpath and decides to reopen it to the public. Comedy, starring Richard Briers.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon applies for a new job in Europe, but whether he gets the post depends on the impression he makes at an important business dinner. Unfortunately, wife Helen contracts lockjaw and is unable to attend, leaving him in desperate need of an escort for the evening. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Billy celebrates his ancestor Robin Hood's birthday by proudly wearing a green suit, and gullible Barry pays tribute in his own way - much to the amusement of everyone else. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Keith Clifford and Mike Grady star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That with Barry and Glenda?.
programme.desc: Truly jumps to the conclusion that Barry is up to no good after he is spotted acting suspiciously, but his real motive for being in the woods with a suitcase is unfathomable. Long-running comedy, staring Mike Grady, Frank Thornton and Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly and Alvin take a group of pensioners to a farm for the day, but their act of charity backfires when it becomes clear the elderly daytrippers are not happy with the idea.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom and Barbara's visits to evening classes become unusually productive, while Margo struggles to master pottery. Comedy, starring Felicity Kendal and Richard Briers.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del's latest foolproof scheme to make a million involves a spot of salmon-poaching, but the wheeler-dealer finds the bracing country air is not all it's cracked up to be. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: An old school friend of Audrey's wishes to visit, but is unaware of her former classmate's unfortunate circumstances, so the former lady of the manor arranges for DeVere to entertain her. Classic comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Guy showers Lucy with expensive gifts before taking her on a mystery weekend away, causing Lee to become suspicious of his motives. He concludes Guy must be a gangster, but Barbara and Tim believe his paranoia about the subject stems from his own yearning for Lucy's affections.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Preparations for Nessa and Dave's wedding are in full swing, Stacey has life-changing news for Gavin, and Bryn and Jason put their big secret to bed once and for all. Finally, the wedding arrives and, as Nessa prepares to make her way to the church, Smithy takes the opportunity to have one last chat. Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden, Ruth Jones and Rob Brydon star.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Julian Clary, Omid Djalili and Reginald D Hunter.
programme.desc: Host Omid Djalili warms up the audience before camp comic Julian Clary and Alabama's finest Reginald D Hunter take the mic at the Hammersmith Apollo in London.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark has a go at online gaming and live role-play with Dobby, and wonders whether she may be the one for him. He and Sophie sort out their annulment, while Jeremy joins a cult. Award-winning comedy, starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: An encounter with a group of children and a pitchfork inspires the boys to make some quick cash by trick-or-treating on Halloween - with the help of an electric cattle prod. Comedy, starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Fowler and Grim get their wires crossed about why they are taking a group of young offenders on a camping trip, and Goody's gallant attempt to rescue Habib from racist hooligans blows up in his face. Patricia, meanwhile, has her hormones sent into overdrive by an abandoned baby. Ben Elton's comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark and Jeremy enjoy their final days of freedom before Sophie's baby is born, determined to ignore the fact that one of them is the father. Mark makes the most of his extra wealth and power after being promoted, spending money on the flat, trying to get Jeremy a job, and pursuing company IT girl Dobby - but his plans go awry during a routine fire drill. Starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Hilda sees Anne climbing over Paul's garden fence and thinks she is having an affair. Comedy, starring Richard Briers.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: As part of the centre's Energy Conservation Week, Colin designs a methane reclamation system for human bio-waste. However, panic ensues when Gavin's pyromaniac ex-fiancee turns up with suitcases containing fuel and lighters, and goes to admire the experiment. Chris Barrie, Michael Burns and Tim Marriott star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Barry Becomes a Psychopathic Killer but Only Part-Time.
programme.desc: Smiler finds himself pursued by a wanton gold-digger who thinks he's rich, but luckily Truly is full of ideas to solve the problem. Stephen Lewis and Frank Thornton star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Things to Do When Your Wife Runs Off with a Turkish Waiter.
programme.desc: Barry and Glenda get a shock when a man they foolishly exchanged addresses with on holiday turns up on their doorstep. To make a strained situation worse, it appears their guest has an unusual hobby.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Beware of Laughing at Nora's Hats.
programme.desc: Alvin tries to persuade Nora Batty to go for a ride in his sidecar, but she's having none of it. When she relates the story of her long-standing feud with Audrey Craig - who had the audacity to laugh at her hat during a wedding many years ago - it becomes clear the broom-brandishing battleaxe is not one to be messed with.(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Irrepressible snob Hyacinth concocts an elaborate plan to rescue Richard from social obscurity by turning him into an executive. His first stop is the local golf club, but he proves far from enthusiastic. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del falls for a glamorous antiques dealer who comes to view an old cabinet described as a `Queen Anne' original - but the feeling is not necessarily mutual. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: May the Force Be with You.
programme.desc: Rodney unwittingly causes uproar in the Trotter household by bringing home a stranger claiming to be an old friend of Del's. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by Jim Broadbent.(n)

programme.title: Marley's Ghosts
programme.desc: In an attempt to make a fresh start, Marley decides to move house, and she and her three accompanying ghosts face a whole host of trials and tribulations as they come to terms with living under the same roof. Ex-lover Michael especially faces problems as his past comes back to haunt him. Comedy, starring Sarah Alexander, John Hannah, Jo Joyner and Nicholas Burns.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The day of the wedding arrives and Bryn is still behaving oddly around Stacey's brother. Nessa debates whether to share her big secret and Smithy resolves to give a superb best man's speech - but finds himself overcome with emotion under the spotlight. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: Unlucky Alf attempts to propose to his girlfriend and football expert Ron Manager is lost for words. Sketch show, with Paul Whitehouse, Charlie Higson, Mark Williams and John Thomson.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Greg Davies, Hal Cruttenden and Simon Evans.
programme.desc: Inbetweeners and Man Down star Greg Davies plays host for another session of stand-up at Hammersmith Apollo in west London, warming up the audience before comedy circuit regulars Hal Cruttenden and Simon Evans take the mic.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes needs someone to look after Grandad so she can treat herself to a much-needed holiday - but with private nursing homes being so expensive, it seems her only option is to convince the health visitor he has lost his marbles. Rory and Dino move in for a couple of weeks, and the matriarch is soon spitting feathers when the latter begins taking over the house, and her late husband gets in touch from beyond the grave with some ominous news. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Fish
programme.desc: Chef Keith Floyd demonstrates how to cook paella, before preparing crab and fishing for cockles in Weymouth. He also rustles up a fish soup during a trawler race in Plymouth.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on France
programme.desc: Globetrotting chef Keith Floyd visits Provence, where he has breakfast with a man who makes nearly all his own food, and goes to a market to pick up the ingredients for fish soup, followed by chicken in garlic.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: John discovers the importance of soup in Korea, goes to Noodle Alley in Seoul to have a go at hand-cutting noodles, and makes a marinated beef stew.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The best six chefs from the week battle it out in the last of the quarter-finals. First the judges Monica Galetti and Marcus Wareing ask them to make a pastry dish of their own invention from 10 ingredients including peaches, champagne, pecan nuts and pudding rice. After a double elimination, the remaining four contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Charles Campion, Jay Rayner and William Sitwell, before finding out who is going through to the knockout week.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: Four young cooks are challenged to bake cakes fit for a queen in a bid to impress judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. Presented by Aaron Craze.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Tom Kerridge takes over as host from Michel Roux Jr on the culinary show, and is joined on the first edition by Si King and Dave Myers. Tom challenges the Hairy Bikers to come up with a speedy meal to rival his quick sausage and bean casserole, while drinks expert Joe Wadsack surprises them all with his choice of wine to match the food. Plus, Fast Show star Arabella Weir goes behind the scenes at one of London's most upmarket hotels to discover the secret to making the perfect sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Great Britain
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels to Yorkshire and discovers how the Industrial Revolution changed Britain's favourite dishes. From Persian-inspired lamb shanks with British ale, to Jewish smoked trout, the chef meets people from all over the world to learn how immigrant workers have drawn on their own ethnic culinary traditions to reflect the changing tastes of Britain today.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on France
programme.desc: The chef visits the Perigord region, beginning in the Dordogne where he prepares a salad with walnut oil. He then travels to the town of Bergerac, touring the market with Bernard Girodel before cooking a crepe omelette with the assistance of Madame Moulin in Tremolat, and ends his journey by visiting the kitchens of Vieux Logis in the village and observes a young chef prepare a fish dish.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on France
programme.desc: The chef visits Gevrey-Chambertin and Dijon in Burgundy, cooking veal with mustard and talking to chef Jean Michel La Fond on a barge on the River Saone. He also serves up a meal of coq au vin for grape pickers on the first day of the harvest, and prepares ham with a wine sauce.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: John heads into the Korean kitchen to find out more about essentials like soy, gochujang and doenjang, before making bossam, a fantastic belly pork dish.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The 12 remaining chefs cook off against each other for the first time and have to create one outstanding dish of their own invention from a selection of meat, fish, fruit and vegetables. To test them even further, the judges have removed all the modern equipment from the kitchen, leaving the contestants to use only the basics of hobs and ovens. The four weakest chefs must return to battle it out for the final two places in the next round and face the challenge of producing a dish using unused ingredients from the previous test.(n)

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: The cooks race to bake a lemon drizzle cake in one hour and create a recipe based on the theme of America. Meanwhile, Aaron Craze finds out about cupcakes.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by MasterChef: The Professionals judge Monica Galetti for a discussion on simple cooking, revealing how to get maximum flavour with minimal fuss. They go head to head to devise the best fuss-free yet impressive recipe, with Monica pitting her honey-glazed chicken against Tom's celery soup with poached egg and soda bread. Plus, resident drinks expert Joe Wadsack tries out a range of alcohol-free beverages.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Great Britain
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver travels to south Wales, where he learns about how late-19th-century coal boom has continued to influence British food culture to this day. He samples classic Italian home cooking, and visits a mosque and community centre in Tiger Bay. Inspired by his experiences, he cooks a 12-hour rabbit bolognese and lamb lollipops with dips and toasted crunchy nuts.(n)
