programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: Keanu Reeves plays Jack Traven, a young cop working with the LAPD bomb squad. Thwarting mad bomber Howard Payne, who has wired up a lift to explode, Traven finds himself the object of revenge. Payne rigs a bomb to a bus which arms when the speed reaches above 50mph and explodes if it drops beneath. With passenger Annie Porter drafted in to replace the injured driver, Traven has to work out how to disarm the bomb and evacuate the passengers while she keeps the bus up to speed in urban LA. Jan de Bont's thriller piles on the action and even after Traven saves everyone on the bus, there's still a roller-coaster finale on a runaway subway train commandeered by Payne(n)

programme.desc: Al Gore; Ralph Reed; Kristen Soltis Anderson; Joshua Green; Michael Weiss. Former vice president Al Gore and political activist Ralph Reed are the interview guests. The panelists are political consultant Kristen Soltis Anderson, and journalists Joshua Green and Michael Weiss(n)

programme.title: Room 104
programme.desc: Pizza Boy. A pizza delivery boy gets caught up in a couple's twisted games(n)

programme.title: Rails & Ties
programme.desc: Kevin Bacon, Marcia Gay Harden, and Miles Heizer star in director Alison Eastwood's tale of two families locked into an emotional -- and physical -- collision course. There once was a time when Tom and Megan Stark had all the time in the world to take their dream vacation and start a family, but these days the couple's marriage is suffering and their time appears to be running short. Megan has been diagnosed with a potentially terminal illness, and when the prospect of losing his wife becomes too much to bear, railroad engineer Tom seeks escape in his work. On the tracks Tom is in control; all the routes are predetermined and he knows he'll eventually arrive at his destination. But sometimes even the most predictable events can go suddenly awry, and when Tom's train hits a car that was parked on the tracks by a suicidal mother, his life is plunged into ruin. While there was no way that Tom could have possibly stopped the train on time, the grieving conductor's woes are suddenly compounded upon realizing that he may lose his job because of the accident. Not only that, but the deceased woman's son, Davey, is consumed by the guilt that he could do nothing to prevent the accident, and he now places the blame for his mother's death squarely on Tom. But not all sad stories have to end in tragedy, and perhaps in the aftermath of this fateful accident Megan could receive a second chance at fulfilling her dreams, Tom could learn to open his heart before he is consumed by bitterness, and Davey could finally learn the true meaning of family(n)

programme.title: Bratz: The Movie
programme.desc: Four teenage girls try to remain best friends forever and reject snooty cliques as they begin high school together in this family film, based on the popular line of dolls, that's filled with fun, fashion and music. Logan Browning, Janel Parrish, Nathalia Ramos, Skyler Shaye, Chelsea Staub. Directed by Sean McNamara(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: A rich Las Vegas eccentric selects six people to hunt down a $2 million jackpot hidden in New Mexico(n)

programme.title: Collateral Beauty
programme.desc: A New York adman (Will Smith) deals with the heartache of losing a child by writing letters to Time, Death, and Love. He is soon visited by representations of the three concepts, and they, along with his close friends, help him return to some semblance of a normal life. Edward Norton, Kate Winslet, Michael Peña, Helen Mirren, Naomie Harris, Keira Knightley, and Jacob Latimore co-star. Directed by David Frankel(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A down-on-his luck auteur gets one more chance at the big time -- provided his neuroses don't swallow him whole -- in Woody Allen's 33rd feature release, Hollywood Ending. Allen plays Val Waxman, a one-time cinematic genius who's resorted to taking advertisement work to pay the bills for himself and his airhead live-in girlfriend, Lori (Debra Messing). Val finds his luck is about to change, however, when he receives the script for The City Never Sleeps, a period noir set against the backdrop of 1940s New York City. It seems his ex-wife, Ellie (Tea Leoni), now an executive at Galaxy Pictures, has been pulling for him to direct the picture, claiming he's the only man who can do justice to the script. She even manages to convince her boyfriend, Hal (Treat Williams), Galaxy's high-powered studio head, to take a chance on Val's "unique vision." Just when the cameras are ready to roll, however, Val finds that unique vision in jeopardy -- literally -- as he's struck with a psychosomatic case of blindness. When physicians and psychiatrists fail to cure him, Val contrives a scheme to forge ahead with the picture, for fear of blowing his one last chance at greatness. Hollywood Ending co-stars George Hamilton and Mark Rydell(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: This spirited romp is a throwback to classic screwball comedies of the 1930s and '40s. Eva Longoria Parker is a scream as a bride who suffers a fatal accident during her wedding, and later returns as a ghost to keep her husband from taking a new lover. Paul Rudd is outstanding as her husband; Lake Bell is a treat as the new woman in his life, a caterer who doubles as a psychic; and Lindsay Sloane is impressive as his kooky sister, Chloe. Written and directed by Jeff Lowell(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: Autism Under the Lens. Gianna Toboni reports on work being done at the forefront of autism research, meets families trying out the newest treatments and discovers a growing self-advocacy movement in the autism community that wants to refocus the science(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: A math genius works as a financial consultant for criminal organizations in this intelligent thriller. While being investigated by the Treasury Department, he agrees to help an accounting clerk look into fraud at her company, but the assignment will prove far more dangerous than he could have ever anticipated(n)

programme.title: The Cell
programme.desc: In this science fiction thriller, child psychiatrist Catherine Deane (Jennifer Lopez) has developed a technique that allows her to travel through the minds of her patients. When Stargher (Vincent D'Onofrio), a multiple murderer who methodically drowns his victims and performs bizarre rituals with their bodies, falls into a coma, FBI agent Peter Novak (Vince Vaughn) asks Deane to enter the killer's psyche, in the hope of finding a missing girl whom Stargher has kidnapped; if she's not soon found, in all likelihood she'll die in his torture cell. However, once Deane enters the bizarre world of Stargher's mind, she finds getting out to be a very difficult matter. The Cell was the first feature from director Tarsem, who previously made award-winning commercials and music videos, including the video for R.E.M.'s "Losing My Religion." The supporting cast includes Catherine Sutherland, Marianne Jean-Baptiste, Dylan Baker, and Pruitt Taylor Vince(n)

programme.title: Mission to Mars
programme.desc: In 2020, astronauts are sent to rescue possible survivors of the first manned mission to Mars, which ended in apprent disaster, in this visually stunning space thriller(n)

programme.title: Hitchcock/Truffaut
programme.desc: Filmmakers discuss the impact of Francois Truffaut's 1966 book "Hitchcock/Truffaut," in which Alfred Hitchcock painstakingly detailed his directorial process(n)

programme.title: Presumed Innocent
programme.desc: After his former girlfriend is killed and he becomes the prime suspect, D.A. Harrison Ford goes on a search to find the real killer and finds out that he/she may be closer to him than he thinks(n)

programme.title: Platoon
programme.desc: This intense drama examines the fight between good and evil among an American infantry platoon in the jungles of Vietnam. Writer/director Stone draws on his own first-hand experiences of combat and takes a close look at the life of foot soldiers, as seen through the eyes of a new recruit(n)

programme.desc: 08-06-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.desc: A chance to catch supervixen Angelina Jolie and her father John Voight in the same film, an explosive action tale adapted from the popular video game. The eponymous heroine races against time to find an ancient relic before it falls into the wrong hands. The buxom adventurer battles a variety of fantastical creatures with the knowledge that the fate of mankind rests in her hands. New 'Bond' Daniel Craig also stars(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Seeds of Expansion. Season 3 begins with Spencer looking to score some high-profile clients to pay off his debts, but he hits a roadblock when Mr. Anderson wants to focus on the Las Vegas market by partnering with a casino magnate. Meanwhile, Ricky ponders fatherhood; Vernon and Reggie eye an edgy endorsement; and Larry makes Charles the face of bad news at a team press conference(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Bull Rush. Spencer goes to Las Vegas on business and gets reacquainted with an old flame who's working for Wayne. Meanwhile, Jason finds himself in a tough neighborhood after Joe sets him up to represent a top running back; Ricky challenges the odds in a game of dice; Charles gets a lesson in public speaking from Julie; and Vernon and Reggie mull a risky endorsement deal(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: In the Teeth. Spencer encounters resistance to his Las Vegas expansion initiative in Los Angeles and Oakland. Meanwhile, Charles feels slighted by Larry for not getting credit after he landed a coveted lineman; Joe takes a detour with Reggie; Jason rebukes Kisan for his lack of transparency; and Ricky jumps to conclusions(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: A World in Disarray. An examination of the past, present and future of U.S. foreign policy and how post-Cold War alliances have shifted features conversations with diplomats, politicians and scholars, including Council on Foreign Relations president Richard Haass; former secretary of state Condoleezza Rice; former British prime minister Tony Blair; former UN ambassador Samantha Power; political scientist Francis Fukayama; and Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.)(n)

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July
programme.desc: The true story of Ron Kovic, a patriotic, All-American small town athlete who shocks his family by enlisting with the Marines to fight in the Vietnam War. Once he is overseas, however, Kovic's gung-ho enthusiasm turns to horror and confusion when he accidentally kills one of his own men in a firefight. His downfall is furthered by a bullet wound that leaves him paralyzed from the chest down(n)

programme.title: Room 104

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: This re-imagining of the Frankenstein mythos focuses on Igor, the assistant of Victor Frankenstein. When the mad scientist builds an undead creature that soon becomes a grave danger, it's up to Igor to save Frankenstein from both the monster and himself(n)

programme.title: Hard Knocks: Training Camp
programme.desc: Episode 1. The series opens in Tampa, as former Heisman winner Jameis Winston, outspoken free agent DeSean Jackson and Pro Bowler Gerald McCoy join rookies and free agents in the first week of drills at the Buccaneers' training camp(n)

programme.desc: The plot revolves around Will Hunting, who is a janitor at M.I.T. and has a unique gift for mathematics. But irresponsibility and carefree attitude becomes a hindrance towards his progress for which he requires help from a psychologist to find direction in his life(n)

programme.desc: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael performs at The Comedy Store in Hollywood. Topics include poverty; crime; national tragedies; and talent versus morals(n)

programme.title: Mr. Destiny
programme.desc: Drowning his sorrows after being fired, Larry finds a mysterious bartender who shows him the life he could have lived. Would he have been a different man if he'd hit that winning run as a kid?(n)

programme.title: Miami Rhapsody
programme.desc: The discovery of marital troubles in her well-to-do Jewish family causes a young woman to question her own upcoming nuptials(n)

programme.title: Taking Care of Business
programme.desc: James Belushi and Charles Grodin team up for this variation on the Prince and the Pauper. Belushi plays Jimmy Dworski, a convicted car thief, serving time in a minimum security prison. But when Jimmy wins a pair of tickets to the World Series from a radio call-in show, he can't resist walking out of jail, particularly when the warden won't even let the inmates watch the series on television. Grodin plays rich workaholic Spencer Barnes, who, when his wife walks out on him right before a long-planned vacation, leaves his datebook in an airport telephone booth. Happening upon Spencer's datebook is Jimmy, who simply intends to return the datebook to Spencer for a 1,000-dollar reward. But when he finds the datebook contains his credit cards, Jimmy assumes Spencer's identity, living the good life and dating the boss's daughter, while making his way to Malibu to return the property to Spencer(n)

programme.title: The Tuxedo
programme.desc: Jackie Chan is a perfect fit in this stylish comedy-adventure about a cabbie-turned-chauffeur who fills in for his out-of-commission secret-agent boss by donning a high-tech suit that enables him to foil villains plotting to sabotage the world's water supply. Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs, Debi Mazar, Ritchie Coster, Peter Stormare(n)

programme.title: Almost Christmas
programme.desc: An estranged family reunite over the holidays for the first time since the death of their matriarch(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: The plot revolves around Will Hunting, who is a janitor at M.I.T. and has a unique gift for mathematics. But irresponsibility and carefree attitude becomes a hindrance towards his progress for which he requires help from a psychologist to find direction in his life(n)

programme.title: Now You See Me 2
programme.desc: In this wildly entertaining sequel, the illusionists known as the Four Horsemen return to perform a spectacular stunt in the hopes of clearing their names and exposing the unscrupulous behavior of a tech mogul. However, the mogul soon turns the tables, and forces the group to steal a revolutionary decrypting device for him(n)

Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs, Debi Mazar, Ritchie Coster, Peter Stormare(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Ice Cube returns as South Central L.A. slacker Craig Jones for this raucous sequel to 1995's "Friday." programme.title: Almost Christmas
programme.desc: An estranged family reunite over the holidays for the first time since the death of their matriarch(n)

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: A successful self-help author comes home for a visit, only to find his mother engaged to his sadistic former gym teacher. Billy Bob Thornton, Susan Sarandon and Seann William Scott star in this outrageous farce. Directed by Craig Gillespie(n)

programme.title: Gung Ho
programme.desc: Comedy about an unemployed man who manages to cajole a Japanese car company into re-opening its plant in his recession-hit town(n)

programme.title: Bean
programme.desc: Bean works as a caretaker at Britain's formidable Royal National Gallery, and his bosses want to fire him because he sleeps at work all the time(n)

programme.title: Moon over Parador
programme.desc: While working in a small nation on the Caribbean, an American actor (Richard Dreyfuss) is convinced by the chief of police (Raul Julia) to impersonate the nation's dictator who has recently passed away. The actor really begins to enjoy the role after a while, thanks in part to the dictator's mistress (Sonia Braga)(n)

programme.title: Tig Notaro: Boyish Girl Interrupted
programme.desc: Comedian Tig Notaro performs at the Wilbur Theatre in Boston. Topics include doing shows in Las Vegas; introducing her fiancée to her family in Mississippi; TSA screenings; small planes; Santa Claus; and misleading text messages. Taped May 31, 2015(n)

programme.title: Screwed
programme.desc: A chauffeur kidnaps his rich boss's dog to hold it for ransom, but when she accidentally gets the dog back, she thinks that it's the chauffeur that has been kidnapped(n)

programme.title: Quick Change
programme.desc: Bill Murray stars in this comedy about three thieves who find robbing a New York City bank easy, but escaping the city to be almost impossible!(n)

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Live: Runteldat
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence is one of America's top black comedians, spoken of in the same breath as the late Richard Pryor and Eddie Murphy when they were at the height of their stand-up powers, and he's also appeared in films including Big Momma's House and Bad Boys. But he's also suffered setbacks in his personal life, from being arrested with a loaded gun at an airport to being accused by his co-star in the TV show Martin of sexual harassment. In this outstanding film of his stand-up routine, he confronts his demons and those who demonise him, as well as veering off to his favourite subject: women, and how hard they are to live with. And 'rundletat' is short for 'run and tell that'(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: Quirky comedy about an oddball schoolboy who is an academically poor student, big-time dreamer and compulsive liar. He falls in love with one of his teachers and in his quest to win her affections enlists the help of an eccentric millionaire - but his new friend is also in love with the same teacher(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: Cameron Diaz is delightful in this offbeat romantic comedy, which is brimming with outrageous gross-out humor. Diaz plays lovelorn club-hopper Christina Walters, who finally finds her Mr. Right in dashing Peter Donahue (Thomas Jane). When Peter leaves town, she and her best friend hit the road so Christina can win his heart. Christina Applegate, Selma Blair, Parker Posey(n)

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: An underachieving bachelor afraid of commitment learns to grow up after befriending the son of one of his conquests(n)

programme.title: Friday
programme.desc: An unemployed young man avoids his father and a bully while trying to help his best friend pay back a debt to a drug dealer(n)

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: George Clooney wears two hats, or in the case of this winning gridiron romp, one hat and one helmet, as both director and star. He plays Dodge Connolly, a 1920s pro-footballer who tries to save his floundering squad by signing a college star (John Krasinski) to help get the team on track and, more important, turn a profit. Renee Zellweger costars as a reporter who becomes the object of affection for both. Randy Newman, who composed the film score, has a cameo as a speakeasy piano player(n)

programme.title: Batman & Robin
programme.desc: This was the third follow-up to Tim Burton's Batman (1989), the original revisionist look at the Gotham City legend, as well as the second in the Batman series directed by Joel Schumacher and the first featuring George Clooney as the Caped Crusader; it features not one but two super-villains, and a new heroine to fight crime alongside Bruce Wayne (aka Batman) and Dick Grayson (aka Robin) (Chris O'Donnell). The experiments of Dr. Victor Fries (Arnold Schwarzenegger) to preserve his late wife cryogenically have gone horribly wrong, turning him into the evil genius Mr. Freeze, who must keep his body at sub-zero temperature in order to say alive -- and he wants to put Gotham City on ice. Shy horticulturist Pamela Isley (Uma Thurman) goes a bit wild with a Venus Fly Trap-like creation she's been working on and mutates into Poison Ivy, who wants to kill all the people on Earth so plants can take over. Can Batman and Robin stop these fiends before their plans go too far? Meanwhile, Bruce and Dick's faithful butler Alfred (Michael Gough) isn't feeling well, so his niece Barbara (Alicia Silverstone) comes to pay a visit. When Barbara finds out what her uncle's employers do in their spare time, she decides she wants in on the action, and she joins the crime fighting twosome as Batgirl. Batman & Robin also features Jesse Ventura in a small role as a prison guard; it would be his last film role before becoming Governor of Minnesota in 1998(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Accused of cheating and desperate to prove his innocence, an eighteen-year-old orphan from the slums of Mumbai reflects back on his tumultuous life while competing to win 20 million rupees on India's Who Wants to Be a Millionaire in Danny Boyle's inspirational drama. Jamal Malik (Dev Patel) may not have a penny to his name, but that could all change in a matter of hours. He's one question away from taking the top prize on India's most popular television game show, but as with everything else in Jamal's life, it isn't going to be easy. Arrested by police under suspicion of cheating, Jamal is interrogated by the authorities. The police simply can't believe that a common "slumdog" could possibly possess the knowledge to get this far in the game, and in order to convince them of how he gained such knowledge, Jamal begins reflecting back on his childhood. As young boys, Jamal and his older brother, Salim, lived in squalor, and lost their mother in a mob attack on Muslims. Subsequently forced to rely on their own wits to survive, the desperate siblings fell back on petty crime, eventually befriending adorable yet feisty young Latika as they sought out food and shelter on the unforgiving streets of Mumbai. Though life on the streets was never easy, Jamal's experiences ultimately instilled in him the knowledge he needed to answer the tough questions posed to him on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire. And though Jamal makes a convincing case for himself, one question still remains: why would a young man with no apparent desire for wealth or fame be so determined to win big on a national game show? Of course, it won't be long until everyone finds out the answer to this burning question, because as Jamal sits down to find out whether he will be rich beyond his wildest dreams, 60 million viewers remain transfixed to their televisions eager to see if he'll correctly answer the final question(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: This fascinating thriller follows the rise and fall of Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twin gangsters who built a criminal empire in London during the 1950s and '60s using gruesome, unhinged tactics and savvy business acumen(n)

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Prolific production designer and art director Catherine Hardwicke makes her directorial debut with the coming-of-age drama Thirteen. Los Angeles teenager and overachiever Tracy (Evan Rachel Wood) is an excellent student in her seventh grade class and gets along well with her mother, Melanie (Holly Hunter). She fears that she's not cool enough to be friends with Evie (Nikki Reed), the most popular girl in school. Fueled with genuine adolescent energy, Tracy follows Evie's lead into the harsh realities of sex, drugs, and hard-edged adventure. Consumed with temptations and conflicting desires, Tracy loses her good-girl identity, greatly affecting her relationship with her mom. Partly autobiographical, Thirteen was co-written by Hardwicke and actual 13-year-old Reed, who are close family friends. Originally intending to write a teen comedy, they ended up creating a hard-hitting drama exposing the contemporary teenage experience. Thirteen was nominated for the Grand Jury Prize at the 2003 Sundance Film Festival, with Catherine Hardwicke taking home the Director's Award(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: They've kept television viewers laughing for nearly 20 years, and now the most popular animated family on the small screen makes the leap into theaters as Homer, Marge, Lisa, Bart, ad Maggie embark on their first-ever feature-length adventure. Directed by David Silverman and written by a whole host of Simpsons veterans including Matt Groening and James L. Brooks, The Simpsons Movie also features special guest appearances by Albert Brooks among others(n)

programme.title: The Blair Witch Project
programme.desc: Combining Hi-8 video with black-and-white 16 mm film, this film presents a raw look at what can happen when college students forego common sense and enter the world of voodoo and witchcraft. Presented as a straightforward documentary, the film opens with a title card explaining that in 1994, three students went into the Maryland back woods to do a film project on the Blair Witch incidents. These kids were never seen again, and the film you are about to see is from their recovered equipment, found in the woods a year later. The entire movie documents their adventures leading up to their final minutes. The Blair Witch incident, as we initially learn from the local town elders, is an old legend about a group of witches who tortured and killed several children many years ago. Everyone in town knows the story and they're all sketchy on the details. Out in the woods and away from their parked car (and civilization), what starts as a school exercise turns into a nightmare when the three kids lose their map. Forced to spend extra days finding their way out, the kids then start to hear horrific sounds outside their tents in the pitch-black middle of night. They also find strange artifacts from (what can only be) the Blair Witch, still living in the woods. Frightened, they desperately try to find their way out of the woods, with no luck. Slowly these students start to unravel, knowing they have no way of getting out, no food, and it's getting cold. Each night they are confronted with shrieking and sounds so haunting that they are convinced someone is following them, and they quickly begin to fear for their lives. The film premiered in the midnight movie section at the 1999 Sundance Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: Satan's hopeless son is banished to earth when he disappoints his father one time too many, but finds New York City just as confusing as hell(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Portrait of a close-knit black family living in 1970s Brooklyn, as seen through the eyes of the youngest daughter. This comedy-drama follows them as they deal with money woes, eccentric neighbors and the sons' troublemaking(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Director Michael Bay returns with his second instalment of the sci-fi action romp that pits humans against some big, bad (very bad) alien robots, the Decepticons. In this sequel, which manages to be even louder and more prone to explosions than the initial outing, Sam Witwicky and his girlfriend Mikaela Banes are once more at the centre of the action. Witwicky is being hunted down by the Decepticons, who recognise that he is their main impediment to their gaining control of an awesome source of energy. As the Decepticons' plan would result in the destruction of the Sun, mankind's fate rests on the shoulders (and in the ingenuity) of our oddly named hero..(n)

programme.title: The World According to Garp
programme.desc: The life of T S Garp, and his mother, Jenny. Whilst Garp sees himself as a serious writer, Jenny writes a feminist manifesto at an opportune time, and finds herself as a magnet for all manner of distressed women(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Two down-on-their-luck pals become arms dealers, but get in over their heads when they land a $300 million contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry to forces in Afghanistan. This raucous comedy-drama is based on true events(n)

programme.title: Closed Circuit
programme.desc: A major terrorism trial ensnares two ex-lovers who both play crucial roles on the defence team. When the lead defence lawyer dies, his replacement proves to be the former lover of a Special Advocate with clearance to view classified evidence(n)

programme.title: Chasing Papi
programme.desc: Smooth-talking Tomas has a gorgeous girlfriend in Chicago... and one in New York, and one in Miami. But life gets really hot when his Latino trio find out about one another(n)

programme.title: The Good Guy

A Wall Street big shot (Scott Porter) seems like the real deal, until she meets his handsome coworker (Bryan Greenberg) and comes to realize love is as big of a gamble as the stock market(n)

programme.title: Civil Brand
programme.desc: Television director Neema Barnette directs the forceful drama Civil Brand, based on a story by Preston A. Whitmore II. Shot with a micro-budget of 500,000 dollars, the film stars confrontational rap and hip-hop artists Mos Def, MC Lyte, and Da Brat. The story concerns a women's prison that exploits its largely African-American inmate population as cheap labor to manufacture products for a corporation. Mostly incarcerated due to domestic violence situations, the inmates also face sexual abuse as the hands of the prison staff, headed by Captain Deese (Clifton Powell) and Warden Nelson (Reed McCants). Accused of murder, Frances Shepard (Lisa Rae) joins forces with inmates Little Momma (Lark Voorhies), Wet (Monica Calhoun), and Nikki Barnes (N'Bushe Wright), as well as law student Michael (Mos Def), in order to start an uprising(n)

programme.title: Airheads
programme.desc: Comedy about a struggling Los Angeles rock band who are so desperate to get their record played on air that they hijack a radio station. The Lone Rangers have had little luck in attracting interest from a record company, so they take their demo tape to Radio KPPX and, armed with water pistols, burst into the studio of the star DJ. But the hold-up goes wrong when their tape is accidentally destroyed(n)

programme.title: Batman Forever
programme.desc: The Dark Knight of Gotham City confronts a dastardly duo: Two-Face and the Riddler(n)

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: This re-imagining of the Frankenstein mythos focuses on Igor, the assistant of Victor Frankenstein. When the mad scientist builds an undead creature that soon becomes a grave danger, it's up to Igor to save Frankenstein from both the monster and himself(n)

Sylvester Stallone heads a high-powered cast(n)

programme.desc: A young drug dealer struggles with the moral implications of his work(n)

programme.title: Defending Your Life
programme.desc: Whimsical afterlife fantasy in which a middle-aged man, killed in a car crash, is asked to justify his life and explain the scantiness of his few acts of bravery and selflessness. Judgement City is a limbo where lives are assessed by an independent tribunal who decide whether the recently deceased are eligible for Heaven. While awaiting the decision that may alter the course of his death, he falls in love with a fellow defendant(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Exuberant musical based on the hit stage show featuring the music of ABBA. 20-year-old Sophie lives on an idyllic Greek island with her free-spirited mother Donna. When Sophie gets engaged to her boyfriend, she decides that she wants her father at her wedding - but unfortunately, she does not know who her father is. She takes matters into her own hands and invites the three possible candidates to the wedding, without the knowledge of her mother. Will Donna reveal who Sophie's real dad is? And is she as reluctant to see her former lovers as she claims?(n)

programme.title: Get Smart

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: Director Roger Michell follows up the hit romantic comedy Notting Hill (1999) with this thought-provoking thriller. Ben Affleck and Samuel L. Jackson star, respectively, as Gavin Banek and Doyle Gibson, two New York men whose lives become accidentally intertwined in a Good Friday fender bender on the FDR Drive. Late for a crucial appointment, hotshot lawyer Gavin tosses Doyle a blank check and leaves the scene, while Doyle, whose car is inoperable, is late for a court-appointed custody hearing. A recovering alcoholic, Doyle's tardiness doesn't sit well with the judge, who - sick of waiting for Gipson - grants custody to Doyle's ex-wife in Doyle's absence. The situation worsens when it becomes evident that Doyle has an equally important file belonging to Gavin, which proves that an elderly man gave Banek's firm power-of-attorney over his foundation. So begins an escalating war of words and deeds between the two men. Soon, egged on by an associate (Toni Collette), Gavin hires a "fixer" (Dylan Baker) to destroy Doyle's credit, forcing Doyle to fire back with some cunning moves of his own. Changing Lanes co-stars William Hurt, Sydney Pollack, and Toni Collette(n)

programme.title: Criminal Activities
programme.desc: In this suspenseful thriller, four friends get in over their heads when they become indebted to a dangerous crime boss. Now, they must kidnap a beloved member of a rival kingpin's family in order to erase their debt, and do so without getting caught or killed in the process(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Three female friends inadvertently bring the devil to their sleepy New England town. He proceeds to seduce each of them, and the trio must work together again to stop him from his plans for total domination(n)

programme.title: Insecure
programme.desc: Hella Open. Issa's sexual frustration prompts her to reassess her dating outlook; Molly meets a potential beau on a girls' night out; Lawrence's new work friends test his commitment(n)

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
programme.desc: Sequel in which Deloris reunites with her sisters to teach music at an inner-city school and save it from being shut down(n)

Jackson star, respectively, as Gavin Banek and Doyle Gibson, two New York men whose lives become accidentally intertwined in a Good Friday fender bender on the FDR Drive. Late for a crucial appointment, hotshot lawyer Gavin tosses Doyle a blank check and leaves the scene, while Doyle, whose car is inoperable, is late for a court-appointed custody hearing. programme.title: Making of 'The Huntsman: Winter's War'
programme.desc: A look at "The Huntsman: Winter's War," a 2016 prequel to "Snow White and the Huntsman" that follows the Huntsman and his secret lover Sara as they attempt to stop Freya the Ice Queen and her evil sister from conquering the forest. The film stars Chris Hemsworth, Charlize Theron and Emily Blunt, and is directed by Cedric Nicolas-Troyan(n)

programme.title: Ballers

Meanwhile, Charles feels slighted by Larry for not getting credit after he landed a coveted lineman; Joe takes a detour with Reggie; Jason rebukes Kisan for his lack of transparency; and Ricky jumps to conclusions(n)

programme.title: Criminal Activities

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two unruly brothers (Zac Efron and Adam DeVine) are forced to find dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii by their parents, who hope that a couple of nice gals will keep their wild behavior under control. However, a pair of hard-partying ladies (Anna Kendrick and Aubrey Plaza) see a viral video in which they plead for dates, and decide to pretend to be the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip. Directed by Jake Szymanski(n)

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: Christopher Nolan, of "Memento" fame, directed this taut and atmospheric crime thriller, a remake of a 1997 Norwegian film. Al Pacino is in top form as L.A. detective Will Dormer, who travels to a remote Alaska town to investigate a murder. Unable to sleep, the weary Dormer is drawn into an intense cat-and-mouse game with the sly and taunting killer. Robin Williams, Hilary Swank(n)

programme.title: Animals.
programme.desc: Squirrels.: Part I. Two squirrel brothers try to survive after their home collapses; a mouse confronts a snake that's about to eat it; a turf war between puppies is settled at a pet store(n)

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In this fantasy thriller, a man is given an unusual opportunity to change the past and alter his future. A man (James Caviezel), whose father (Dennis Quaid) died 30 years ago when he was just a boy, makes a startling discovery when working with his ham radio one night: he can speak with his late father over the radio. Having inadvertently found a way to reach into the past, the man desperately struggles to warn his father of the dangers that will come his way, in hopes of changing his tragic fate. Frequency also stars Andre Braugher, Elizabeth Mitchell, and Shawn Doyle(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Two journalists, along with a self-proclaimed 'angel expert' are sent to Iowa to investigate a claim that an angel is living in a motel. They arrive to find the claim is true, but angel Michael is nothing like they expected. He smokes, drinks and loves the ladies. He agrees to travel to Chicago with the journalists, a decision that changes all their lives(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Whoopi Goldberg stars in Emile Ardolino's comedy thriller as Deloris Van Cartier, a lounge singer at a casino managed by her lover VInce LaRocca. He's also a drugs baron and when she accidentally interrupts him in the process of rubbing out a stool pigeon, she has to run for her life. To keep her safe until LaRocca can be charged, the police arrange for her to become Sister Mary Clarence at a nunnery overseen by stern Mother Superior. But you can't keep a good singer down and Sister Mary has soon so successfully invigorated the choir with her musical talent that the church is packed - and there is even a call from Rome for a Papal performance. Unfortunately, thanks to an inside man in the police department, LaRocca learns of her whereabouts and sets out to prevent her testifying; can her new found friends, the nuns, protect her?(n)

programme.title: Book of Shadows: Blair Witch 2

William Hurt, Tom Everett Scott, Lauren Graham, Nicky Katt, James Eckhouse, Patrick Breen(n)

programme.title: House on Haunted Hill
programme.desc: Remake of the 1950s horror in which a millionaire offers a million pounds to anyone who can spend a night in a creepy mansion that was once an asylum for the insane. When a group takes up his offer, they are unaware that their rich benefactor has rigged the house so he can have some fun for his money. However, he is unprepared for the possibility that the house might really be haunted(n)

programme.title: Haunter
programme.desc: A teenager and her family seem doomed to repeat the same day over and over again. Can she unlock the mystery?(n)

programme.title: Red Dragon
programme.desc: After the successful The Silence of the Lambs and Hannibal, Anthony Hopkins once again plays the perverse, cunning killer Hannibal Lecter in this prequel based on the homonymous book by Thomas Harris. Will Graham (Edward Norton) is an FBI investigator, an expert in analizing the minds and procedures of serial killers. After the dangerous arrest of Dr. Hannibal Lecter (Hopkins), Graham decides to end his career as a federal agent to retire and rest in Florida with his wife Molly (Mary-Louise Parker) and their son. However, the sudden appearance of a sadistic murderer known as Tooth Fairy (Ralph Fiennes), leads the investigator to be summoned again by his mentor, Jack Crawford (Harvey Keitel) to catch the criminal. Due to the extreme complexity of the case, Graham goes to Lecter himself for help. Trusting this sinister murderer does not seem to be quite the right thing to do, determined as he is to toy with the fate of the agent and his family. Emily Watson rounds off the multi-star cast of this distressing psychological thriller directed by Brett Ratner, who masterfully applied the exact doses of suspense and horror to the story(n)

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Big Brother's Anna Nolan introduces her second pic of the night. The Coen Brothers multi-award-winning film (two Oscars, best director at Cannes, five BAFTAs) stars Frances McDormand as the heavily pregnant, slow-speaking but quick-witted Chief of Police of a small Minnesotan town who suddenly finds she has three murders on her hands as kidnappers Steve Buscemi and Peter Stormare happen to pass through(n)

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: Dutch (Arnold Schwarzenegger) is the head of a specialized military rescue team in this science fiction action feature. He is sent to South America where he meets with his CIA friend Dillon (Carl Weathers), and the two combine forces to rescue some stranded American soldiers. The hunters become the hunted when an outer-space alien killer known as the Predator begins to kill the soldiers. Four special-effects artists were nominated for an Academy Award for their work in this feature(n)

programme.title: Dredd
programme.desc: A feared urban cop takes on a vicious city drug dealer in a futuristic metropolis as director Pete Travis (Vantage Point) and screenwriter Alex Garland (28 Days Later, Sunshine) team to bring iconic 2000A.D. lawman Judge Dredd to the big screen. In the future, much of North America has been poisoned by radiation. The sprawling urban jungle Mega City One stretches from Boston to Washington D.C., and in order to keep the growing criminal element in check, police enforcers called "Judges" have been given the power of judge, jury, and executioner. Judge Dredd (Karl Urban) is the most feared of them all, delivering death sentences with impunity as he fights to rid the streets of "Slo-Mo" -- a powerful new drug that alters its user's perception of time. In the process of training psychic rookie Cassandra Anderson (Olivia Thirlby), Dredd receives a report of an incident in a sprawling criminal stronghold ruled by fearsome drug lord Ma-Ma (Lena Headey), and ventures in to investigate. Upon learning that one of her top men has been captured by Dredd shortly thereafter, an enraged Ma-Ma seizes control of her massive 200-story complex, launching an all-out war against the Judges as Dredd and Cassandra find themselves trapped in the belly of the beast(n)

programme.title: Predator

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Pete Waterman chats about reuniting some of the big names from his Hit Factory years at the Livewire Festival, and reminisces about the era when he gave rise to some of the biggest name in pop music. Plus, Love Island star Marcel and some of his Blazin' Squad band mates talk about reforming for a one-off show.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Christine Lampard.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.desc: Celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines and a recipe in the kitchen. Presented by Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford. Includes local weather.(n)

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Andrea McLean, Linda Robson, Janet Street-Porter and Katie Price chat about the issues that have everyone talking today.(n)

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.(n)

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, which sees a team of five bankers competing to answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of popular culture and general knowledge. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jacob is implicated in a terrible accident caused by Josh and is questioned by the police. He is torn between his loyalty to his friend and the consequences of remaining silent. Rebecca is left feeling uneasy, and Adam has a confrontation with a friend.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: After being fired for having no insurance, Gary tells Joe he will take the security job in the Ukraine. Meanwhile, Robert returns home on bail, Rosie dupes Todd and Adam into giving her an interview, and Sinead wonders what's bothering Chesney.(n)

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team head to Hythe, Hampshire to create a sensory outdoor space for a four-year-old girl with severely limited vision, who will one day go completely blind. The team transform the family's current bland garden into a safe family haven where little Isabelle can learn about the outside world in a comfortable environment.(n)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Steve from Blackpool searches for his birth mother who gave him up for adoption when he was a baby. After her partner tragically died when she was only 17-years-old, she had no choice but to try and find a new family for her son, and put an advert in the local paper to try and find him the best possible parents. Meanwhile, Corine searches for the son she gave up for adoption when she was just 15-years-old, but fears he may not forgive her once he finds out she has since adopted two other children.(n)

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Car Crash Britain: Caught on Camera.

programme.title: May the Best House Win
programme.desc: Four homeowners in Warrington, Cheshire, invite one another to rate their properties, with a £1,000 prize awarded to the winner. Under scrutiny are a property with a front room modelled on Dickens's Old Curiosity Shop, an Edwardian home with a modern twist, a James Bond-style new build, and a glamorous `wag pad'. Narrated by Guy Porritt.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.(n)

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash competes against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jacob's loyalty lands him in trouble, Leyla is puzzled, and stubborn Lawrence stands his ground.(n)

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: The True Cost of Parking: Tonight.
programme.desc: Fiona Foster investigates the private parking industry, revealing how this sector is making millions of pounds by issuing a ticket every seven seconds in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Megan is touched by Frank's claims to have changed his ways as he outlines his plans for the future. However, Charity sees them together and warns her that they need to stick to the plan. Jacob has an important decision to make, and Lawrence feels chastened.(n)

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef visits the region of Jura, where a local farmer shows him around his orchards and teaches him about the region's apples and pears, which James uses as the accompaniment in a barbecued duck. He also visits Fort des Rousses, the old military stronghold that is now used for the making of Comte, one of the country's most popular cheeses.(n)

programme.title: Inside London Fire Brigade
programme.desc: Fifty-year-old crew manager Aldo is about to retire, but not before he hands over the baton to 25-year-old rookie Joe, who is put to the test fighting his first fire. Brixton firefighter Josie uses a thermal camera to locate the flames in a top-floor flat filling with smoke, Tami is called to an incident on Westminster Bridge, and Neil and Barry from the Fire Investigation Team attend the aftermath of a disaster where the homeowner failed to get out alive. It's their job to piece together what happened. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Schofield's South African Adventure
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and wife Steph go shopping in Cape Town's Greenmarket Square, before he rides the cable car to the top of South Africa's Table Mountain and reveals the secrets of the wildlife that lives at the top. From the summit, Phillip views Robben Island, where Nelson Mandela was incarcerated and shares the inspiration that the anti-apartheid revolutionary's hope alive. He then plays daredevil by heading down the mountain via the world's highest commercial abseil, before tasting the wine at Groot Constantia, South Africa's oldest vineyard.(n)

programme.title: Lion Country: Night and Day
programme.desc: Tensions between the two prides build when their territories begin to overlap. This has dangerous consequences for an orphaned elephant, which is searching for its family but has strayed into the middle of the conflict. A lioness gives birth to a litter of cubs, which face an uncertain future when three rivals try to expand their territory, while two dominant males seek to reclaim control of their old pride.(n)

Drama, starring Leslie Ash, Lesley Dunlop, Tony Haygarth and Lee Warburton.(n)

Sophie Ward joins the regular cast, including Sarah Tansey, Duncan Bell and Aislin McGuckin.(n)

Jenny is relieved when she finally gets a medical diagnosis explaining her recent symptoms, but the news brings a difficult decision for husband Dennis, who has to choose between his wife and his police career. Starring newcomer Sophie Ward, Oliver Montgomery, Duncan Bell and Sarah Tansey.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Suspicion falls on Adam over missing hospital funds and Mike attends a meeting to assess the mental welfare of a 50-year-old man (guest Andrew Dunn) who still lives with his mother. Elsewhere, Gordon's former father-in-law pays an unexpected visit with sobering news and Ken makes a confession to his colleagues. Guest starring Michael Jayston.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: When the Green Woods Laugh - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Pop can barely contain his glee as his beloved Mariette's wedding draws closer, until a summons from the magistrate threatens to turn it into a far from `perfick' day. Whimsical drama, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: You're Only Young Twice
programme.desc: Cissie shocks the other ladies with her behaviour after returning from a funeral.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: A flu epidemic hits the depot, improving Stan's financial health as he and Jack clock up overtime. Vintage comedy, starring Reg Varney.(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby asks Philip for a native charm to help him seduce the delectable Ruth - but his dreams of a romantic liaison soon go up in smoke. Comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter, Frances de la Tour, Richard Beckinsale and Don Warrington.(n)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The leader of a censorship campaign comes to Oxford on a speaking tour, and Morse is charged with protecting her in light of a series of death threats. A bricklayer working on a controversial pop singer's house is later found dead, and when a second killing occurs, a connection emerges to the speaker's movement, plunging Morse into the middle of a conflict over the nature of British culture.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin investigate when former top-flight footballer Robbie Nichols is murdered in the East End of London, in what appears to be a robbery gone wrong. They question a man seen in the area on the night of the killing, who protests his innocence and points the finger at a known gangster he claims was also at the scene. With the detectives at odds over who to believe, Steel finds it increasingly difficult to prosecute the accused. Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Ben Daniels star.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part one of two. A killer starts dumping the bodies of homeless men in the financial district of Bradfield, leaving little for Tony to work on except the bizarre ritualistic nature of the crimes. Oxbridge graduate DI Andy Hall fills in for Alex when she suffers a family bereavement and Kevin moves into Tony's flat to offer police protection when it becomes clear a stalker has the clinical psychologist in his or her sights. Drama, starring Robson Green, with Mark Letheren and John Hopkins.(n)

programme.title: World Cup Rivalries
programme.sub-title: World Cup Rivalries: Brazil v Italy.
programme.desc: Revisiting some of the most riveting matches played by the rival footballing nations.(n)

programme.desc: The Chief suspects a sinister campaign of terror when a recently widowed woman is tormented by mysterious voices. Police drama, starring Raymond Burr.(n)

programme.desc: CI5 enters a deadly race with the KGB to free a suspected double agent while he is in transit from prison to court, in the hope the action will flush out a mole operating inside the unit. Action adventure, starring Gordon Jackson, Lewis Collins and Martin Shaw.(n)

Spy thriller, directed by Martin Campbell and starring Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007, with Eva Green, Mads Mikkelsen, Judi Dench and Giancarlo Giannini.(n)

Cold War action adventure, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Freddie Jones, David Huffman and Warren Clarke.(n)

programme.title: Monsignor Renard
programme.desc: Drama series set during the dark days of the Second World War, starring John Thaw as Augustin Renard, a priest whose return from the Spanish Civil War coincides with a victorious German Army's invasion of his native France. With Cheryl Campbell, Jimmy Yuill and Alfred Lynch.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Julia is assigned a compensation case brought by a man who has sustained spinal and brain damage in an accident at work, and tries to persuade Kavanagh to lead her. Unfortunately, he already has his hands full with a tricky compensation case and son Matt's attempts to get the better of him. John Thaw stars, with Ned Sherrin, Frances Tomelty and TP McKenna.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Rose receives tragic news about Gregory Wilmott, while Hazel has to deal with Jack's death and husband James's return from the front.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert's interview with the management consultants doesn't go as planned when it ends up as a painful self-analysis of his ability as a doctor, but although his skills on the wards and in the operating theatre prove otherwise, it's enough to make the beleaguered doc hand in his resignation. Arch-enemy Jack is over the moon about the turn of events and reckons his day couldn't get any better, blissfully unaware that Christine has got her hands on a copy of an X-ray that proves his own shortcomings. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Emily finds out she is pregnant, but the joy is tempered by ill-feeling from the Jacobs family over the death of their father, who was run over by a tractor. Meanwhile, Kate enjoys peculiar cravings. Sixties-based drama, starring Nick Berry.(n)

programme.title: Monsignor Renard
programme.desc: Madeleine reluctantly begins re-examining her attitude to the Germans and Renard is arrested for an act of resistance, forcing him into a battle of wills with the secret police. Wartime drama, starring John Thaw and Cheryl Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A brother and sister stand accused of murdering their father and stepmother, and pleading for them proves to be the most complex assignment of Kavanagh's entire career. The task is made doubly difficult by the man's insistence on defending himself and a tragedy within his own family - and Julia's decision to leave chambers does not help either. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Anna Chancellor and Art Malik.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Spanish Chest.
programme.desc: A lavish dinner party proves to be a prelude to murder and intrigue - but fortunately Poirot is among the guests, and soon realises the key to the mystery lies in a duel fought 10 years previously. Drama, starring David Suchet, Caroline Langrishe and John McEnery.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Theft of the Royal Ruby.
programme.desc: The Belgian detective looks forward to a quiet Christmas, but is disturbed by the Foreign Office when an Egyptian prince loses a famous ruby - after making the mistake of lending it to a mysterious woman. Guest starring Stephanie Cole, Nigel Le Vaillant and Tariq Alibai.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: The third and final series of Chris Chibnall's crime drama set in a Dorset seaside town reaches a conclusion after a multitude of twist and turns, countless red herrings and numerous suspects with shaky alibis. In the last-ever episode the truth is finally revealed as detectives Alec Hardy and Ellie Miller finally untangle the web of deceit surrounding the rape of Trish Winterman. Starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman, with Julie Hesmondhalgh, Charlie Higson, Jodie Whittaker and Lenny Henry. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A fisherman's body is found tangled up in a North Sea trawler's net. Vera and her team investigate with the help of the local harbourmaster, and find the dead man's sons pointing the finger at the owner of a fish market, with whom they have a long-running feud. Retracing the dead man's steps, Vera discovers when he drowned and tracks down a waitress who may have been one of the last people to see him alive. However, the case becomes more complicated when a witness runs away and a boat belonging to the dead man's sister-in-law goes up in flames.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: Melbourne warns Victoria that Parliament will not be happy about her marrying a German prince, a prediction that proves all too accurate when the Privy Council refuse to grant Albert a royal title. The prince fears for his future in England, while Victoria succumbs to paranoia, becoming convinced that he only intends to marry her for the financial independence he will gain.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The beleaguered barrister puts aside his domestic problems to defend a prostitute on the charge of murdering a high-profile businessman - a tricky case made all the more difficult by the discovery that she has many enemies, all of them determined to blacken her character. Drama, starring John Thaw.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Preston and Shaw investigate a serious aggravated burglary case in which the female victim was attacked with a knife by a masked intruder. programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The resourceful barrister defends an Army chaplain accused of murdering his brother. His efforts are not exactly helped by the client's refusal to speak - leaving him to wonder whether he is suffering from shell-shock brought on by a tour of Bosnia or whether he has something to hide. Starring John Thaw, with John Wood, Richard Pasco, Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A seemingly open-and-shut inquiry prompted by a lost suitcase reveals a long-running family feud. Meanwhile, Nick gets involved with a security alert at the village fete. Nostalgic drama, starring Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Lady Prudence's society friends are rehearsing their show at Bellamy House when an air raid warning sounds, forcing everyone to shelter underground. As Richard surveys his damaged property the next day, a telegram arrives with chilling news about James.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A coach crash on the M62 causes chaos for the staff as A&E is overrun with patients needing treatment, while Sam is shocked to find her badly beaten brother waiting at reception. Elsewhere, new doctor Danny has a baptism of fire when he informs the wrong family of a patient's death - and later gets held up at gunpoint, along with Robert, by a man seeking revenge for the death of his son. Starring Martin Shaw and James Murray.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective sets out for Norfolk when a country publican begs him to help solve a murder - but is disappointed when the innkeeper turns out to be a budding author and the killing fictional. However, he soon has food for thought when a real death occurs - committed by a seemingly ghostly hand. Geraldine Alexander and Ian McCulloch guest star, with David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Affair at the Victory Ball.
programme.desc: The sleuth is invited to attend a masquerade ball dressed as someone famous and modestly goes as himself - and finds time amid the revelry to solve the murder of aristocratic fellow guest Lord Cronshaw. David Suchet stars.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet voices her concerns to Dodson about Gill's drinking, hoping it can be dealt with amicably, so she's unnerved when her observations are taken more seriously than she intended. Meanwhile, just as Rachel feels like she's getting to grips with the sergeant's job, she makes a fatal error that puts Janet and Chris in danger. The body of a man who disappeared 15 years previously is found on the moors. Inquiries lead to a nearby farm, where the detectives encounter something much more sinister than they could have anticipated.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The discovery of slaves on the Pritchard farm has turned a murder inquiry into a multi-agency operation. The enormity of the case brings Dodson to Syndicate 9, keen to establish Gill's state of mind and efficacy as senior officer. Having been the driver involved in the fatal collision with Cal Pritchard, Janet is under investigation and unable to interview the man's widow Evie. Devastated by the consequences of her actions, the detective eventually finds solace in Chris's calm and kind reasoning, but when an incandescent Evie smells alcohol on Gill's breath, she has all the ammunition she needs to discredit the case and bring the DCI down.(n)

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The return of the detective drama set in the 1950s, starring James Norton and Robson Green. Sidney receives a series of anonymous phone calls, which he realises may be linked to a series of murders in which the victims were all important community figures killed by someone who leaves dead birds as a grisly calling card. The threat forces Sidney to question whether he can reconcile his relationship with Amanda and his calling as a vicar. Leonard bonds with Hilary as she cares for her dying father, while Geordie's investigation of the killings leads him to a mysterious home for people with disabilities.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Charles Jantzen and his team launch an emergency mission to rescue hundreds of trapped and abandoned pets.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Charles Jantzen and Debbie Michielson rescue dogs on the brink of turning feral from their dead owner's property.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Vermont teenager Brianna Maitland, who vanished after leaving her family's farm after dropping out of high school, intent on getting her life back on track. Four days after the 17-year-old was last seen by friends in March 2004, her slightly damaged car was recovered from outside an abandoned farmhouse.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes

programme.desc: The case of a missing Californian teenager, who was presumed to have run away. However, her body turned up in a ditch 20 miles away.(n)

The case turned into a murder investigation when Kelsey's body was recovered from a lake in Missouri a month later.(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: The most perplexing murder cases to land on detectives' desks, featuring the methodology used to reveal the identities of the most ingenious killers. This instalment focuses on the disappearance of an oil executive from the front of his New Jersey home. Police feared a medical emergency until a ransom note arrived from an eco-terrorist organisation.(n)

programme.desc: Detectives investigating a couple's execution identify suspects based on phone records - but find they all give contradictory statements.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.desc: The murder of store manager Mary Peterson, who was found stabbed to death in her bed. A tip from an unlikely source helped identify her killer and school dropout-turned-robber James Woodham eventually pleaded guilty to the 1994 attack.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: In October 1989, the theft of $71,000 from a bank in Noel, Missouri, was accompanied by the disappearance oif its president, leaving police wondering if Dan Short have could have robbed his own bank. Five days later however, his body was found duct-taped to a chair in the Great Lake o' the Cherokees. The tape proved vital in identifying and later convicting two siblings of the crimes.(n)

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Patricia Kimmi, who disappeared from her home in Horton, Kansas, in November 2009. Roger Hollister, an acquaintance of the victim's husband, was later convicted of murder after his wife led detectives to a piece of land where skeletal human remains were unearthed and confirmed to be Kimmi's.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
